His past credits are unspeakable pieces of trash, and he looks to have no intention of reinventing himself. House of the Dead is Boll's first attempt at American success. Based on a mildly popular video game series, the movie was intended to be a fast paced horror romp, with servings of gore, sex and effects driven action. And as you watch it, you may think, where did Boll go wrong?Well, it may be easier if you ask: Where didn't he go wrong? Everything that was attempted in this movie turns out to be a complete failure. Take the storyline, for example. House of the Dead's plot revolves around 4 party-goers in what seems to be their late 20s arriving at an ravaged island where the party of a lifetime was supposed to be taking place. OK, this party is basically around 40 people in the middle of what looks to be a Canadian pine forest, overlooking one of the murkiest, horrible looking beaches I've ever seen. Evil deeds ensue, and before you know it, that girl that was just flashing her t*** just got tackled by a horde of men draped in grey rags with red lights for eyes. And how's this for a great plot development. Our sole victoring hero is none other than a character we meet at least 40 minutes into the film. All of the original characters we were supposed to become attached to die, making the first act of the movie utterly useless. OK, to be fair, one of the original characters lives. Even though she plain got stabbed through her cleavage, shattering her chest plate and surely puncturing her heart, she lives. Obviously the writers never heard of anything called a medical journal. When you have a character living, limping and standing upright after having a sword impaled into her heart, you know you've got a bad movie on your hands.I should also mention the screenplay. This has to be the biggest piece of vile **** I have ever witnessed. Such classic lines like "That's Spanish..... in case you don't speak Mexican" and "Why do I want to be immortal? TO LIVE FOREVER!" Unless the writers took a really unhealthy dump on a piece of paper and started writing the screenplay in it with their fingers, they aren't successfully capturing the essence of the script.And whomever it was that came up with the 'heart pounding' action sequences, I'm sure they had personal ambitions to make this movie sink lower than any movie before it. Imagine a lengthy battle scene containing gun wielding college students with extensive firearm training, against nonthreatening zombie-like minions that don't do terribly much. Couple this with over 15 instances of long bullet time moments, transitions of awful, grainy video game footage and some strange 'fly around character and fade to red' effect that I safely predict won't become the next horror movie trend. I must admit, the main action sequence is a brave step. Boll tried many new things, many old things and many many bad things. But even the bravest of people end up dead, or in this case, broke.Take it from me, this movie just plain reeks. In fact, it could even be passed off as a movie made purposely bad. I've only touched on some of the major flaws that exist in the film, as some are too tormenting to relive. All in all, House of the Dead is one of the better examples of how far a movie can miss it's mark. It goes from bad, to funny bad, to the one of the worst films ever.... in the first 20 seconds. But please, don't let that discourage you. After all, this is probably Uwe Boll's finest hour.1.5/10

Where do you even start to "comment" on the rubbish in this film?  Let me restart, it's not all bad.  On the bright side, it had more blood than I had expected, zombies were plenty, brief nudity is always welcome, and the title, of course, House of the Dead.  The problem is the house was about 4 rooms big and was only explored during the last portion of the film.   The plot was very thin and lacked any detail, for characters or for a setting. Even the starring villian, the main zombie, was left highly undeveloped. However, the film did teach me that if I am stuck in a life and death situation, I too will possess martial arts skills and highly accurate marksmanship.  The use of "bullet time" camera effects was highly over used. The video game footage cut scenes were too and the character deaths were just plain...stupid.  To sum it up, horrible plot and acting...sounds like this one might be a cult classic in the future (unfortunately).

****SPLOILER I recently saw this movie on DVD and it easily ranks as one of the top 5 worst movies I ever saw along with Gymkata(a classic) and Virus. When I decided to rent this I was looking for a bloody gore/action movie because I was in the mood for that type of movie. I had stumbled across this "gem" in Blockbuster and remembered the trailer after picking it up and decided what the heck I'll watch it. It's funny because it said, "based on a video game" on the back and I couldn't remember what video game they were talking about. Well trust me you find out in the movie because they actually flash clips from the video game in the movie. The first time I saw that, I thought I was imaging things because I couldn't believe my eyes, I actually rewinded it not once but TWICE because the clip had NO BUSINESS being in that part of the movie. But as the movie progresses this becomes a very common occurrence. Anyway the plot of this movie is hilarious. The group of kids shows up to a rave on an island to find the "rave" abandoned. I put rave in quotes because when you see this party it looks like one of those parties from sixth grade where the girls and guys act all awkward towards one another and nobody knows how to dance. There is even a volleyball net set up with people playing volleyball to complete the stupidity of calling it a rave. Anyway the group missed the boat to the rave by 15 minutes so they pay Captain Kirk (I'm not joking) and his quasi-gay Igor like henchman Salish (Clint Howard) to take them there only to find the no one there. I loved how the zombies basically kill everyone on the island, yet when these morons show up they walk all over the island with no incident until meeting up with the remaining survivor.  The zombie's attack, yadayadayada it gets so dumb that its funny that is what is important. I also love how in these types of movies, everyone suddenly knows how to use a gun like a freaking expert marksman. Oh well, I should have seen this coming from the moment I rented this one. After all, when Clint Howard is your big name star, you know you're in trouble. Another hilarious aspect of this movie was the 360 degree close ups of each character firing their "trademark" weapon. If you watch carefully its even funnier cause they aren't even firing at anything. The inserting of the video game clips was original, yet it also unintelligent.  What I fear is that this director opened a Pandora's Box with this move, enticing other directors out there to do the same such thing in their movies. Somewhere out there, some director will think its a good idea and copy it. Its bound to happen, it always does. But for a really good laugh watch the footage of the main actresses preparing for the role in the movie. I swear it's priceless. In seriousness I give this movie a zero, but for unintentional comedy purposes Id have to give it a 7, maybe an 8 if you watch it in a certain state of mind.

reviews.review_title: One of th Worst Movie of ALL TIME
reviews.content: House of the Dead is positively one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I am a big horror movie fan and this was a real disappointment.  If any one is reading this and thought Blair Witch 2 was the worst horror movie ever, guess again!  Don't waste any money renting this movie!  The plot revolves, much like the video game, around a group of young people traveling to a "cursed" island.  When the group reaches the island they find that all the party-goers have dissapeared and soon find themselves fighting off the most poorly constructed zombies of all time.  People watching this movie in 1950 would probably have complained about how lame the special effects are. The plot is worse than that of BW 2 and to top it all off the frequently flash to scenes, from the video game, of zombies being shot.  The only thing scarier than this movie is the thought of having to watch it again.

reviews.review_title: This movie is only worth seeing because it is so bad it is funny
reviews.content: This movie was terrible...  The plot is almost non-existent, and implausible at the best of times.  The camera work looks like something that a high school student could have thought of.  The acting is dire and there is nothing about the characters to make you feel any sort of empathy with them. The only thing that can really be said in its favor is that it is so bad it becomes funny.  I have in fact only seen one movie that I believe to be worse...  Save your money and drink tequila instead - the headache afterwards will be better than watching this movie.  You would have thought that you would feel more intelligent after the movie because it was clearly made by people with a collective IQ of 4, but it has a brain numbing effect that no matter how hard you laugh at the movie still leaves you feeling drained.

reviews.review_title: "The worst movie i ever ever come across."
reviews.content: When i was watching this terrible pile of crap i was thinking to my self as a young filmmaker that this movie raised my self esteem. Seeing this movie made my movies look like a work done by Steven Spielberg. When i saw this movie i wanted to meet who ever directed this movie and beat the living crap out of him.Lets take a look at what was bad about this movie.*The acting was that of a kindergarten school play. *The people that send videos into "Americas Funniest Home Videos" could of done a better job at the cinematography. *They put scenes from the video game in it. *My 97 year old great grandmother could of done a better job at special effects. *They plot was nothing close to "House Of The Dead". *The music was so incredibly terrible that if i ever hear it again i want to have a gun in my hand so i can kill myself.If i ever meet the person that made this film i will slap him.

reviews.review_title: Any chance I can get my time back?
reviews.content: To begin with I became rather excited to see this movie when at a convention. They were giving away all this cool promo stuff to a new "horror movie" called House of the Dead...if only I had known.I paid good money to see this movie and quite frankly, my money back wouldn't suffice. I want my time back.This is a movie that would make Ed Wood Jr. go "what is this?". It seems to be a collage of random zombie violence and boob shots (not nearly enough to help out though). Made off a video game I expected a "Resident Evil" and got some horrible filming and bad acting. The director tried a "Matrix" look with the cool freeze frames and 360 degree spins but that the best you get in this movie.Don't see it...and please stop funding this man's films!! Support independent films and not this guy! Oh and I would give it 0 stars...but that isn't an option...there should be negative numbers just for Uwe Boll films!

reviews.review_title: The most horrible film of all time
reviews.content: I love B-horror movies, but this film sucked!! It wasn't even a crappy B movie. Everything about it was horrible, the "zombies" looked too fake even for B standards and you can find better acting in a soap opera which isn't saying much.If you want good B-horror check out I SPIT ON YOUR GRAVE, DEAD ALIVE, DAWN OF THE DEAD (the original) OR DAY OF THE DEAD. This movie makes Freddy Vs. Jason worthy of an Oscar and I thought that was the worst before seeing this piece of s@#t. And what's even sadder is the same director is set to direct a possible Bloodrayne movie. There goes what could've been another great film.

(SPOILERS AHEAD) I didn't know ravers required Shaolin Temple/Navy Seal training before embarking onto island raves. Every time the ravers get a hold of a gun, all turn into Starship Troopers. We also learn that one raver is bestowed with the power to commit a selfless act of bravery as he dies. Its good to point out here that it was the most selfish raver of them all, how poetic. Maybe ravers from were Uwe Boll is from are like that,who knows? Not five minutes after the Asian raver girl is introduced she has a full out kung fu fight with a zombie(stereotype by the way).I don't want to be picky, but since when can zombies swim,run, and jump off of mini trampolines. I was expecting for the ravers to start getting picked off by a sniper zombie. How convenient is it that the captain just so happens to be the biggest arms dealer on the east coast. I was surprised it didn't say "reload" on the side of the screen...oh wait...it did say it. Wow Boll, was it your idea to put clips from the game in the movie? That is single-handedly the WORST idea ever. I guarantee 80% of the budget went into ten seconds of the film which consists of some bullet-time(which makes it look like the camera is broken) and the cgi of three bullets. If i made a movie with a bunch of old Ninja Turtles action figures and my 1985 huge-ass camcorder, I would end up with better cinematography,acting,story etc. The acting/writing, was atrocious. In one particular scene a guy falls asleep ten seconds after watching his girlfriend start swimming naked in the water.Now lets talk about zombies, I swear on everything that's good on earth I saw an old lady with long hair and no make-up on just walking among the zombies.Right after her introduction, one of the ravers finds her the most threatening and unloads half a clip into her head.The only reason you should maybe download the second half of this movie for FREE is the scene were a zombie sticks his head up from behind a log and it gets instantaneously blown up by the cop(who's name is casper and whoshould be black listed in Hollywood for the worst act job ever bar none). Also that one of the early pointless girl characters that gets naked looks like Fiona from Eurotrip.Uwe Boll needs to be fired...wait no...he should be descended upon with the fury of the four horsemen of the apocalypse. This is a call to arms for all film watchers. Write letters, begin message boards, if you ever come across Uwe,give him a good kick in the bolls. Do everything in your power to not let this disaster ever happen again. Your help is needed now more than ever as he isslated to direct three more video game to movie adaptations as we speak. P.S. I still can't believe it ended in a sword fight between two ravers and the Spanish madman zombie king

reviews.review_title: Just when you think this movie cant suck anymore... you were wrong.
reviews.content: Just finished the worst film i have ever seen and it makes me wonder how anybody with an I.Q of 4 or over can produce this film.A whole bunch of retards decide to go to a rave on some deserted island (familar?) and miss their boat. They happen to see a captain who smuggles weapons (which will be used later) and his bitch with a hook for an arm (familar?). They say how spooky the island is but take em anyway. Form then on if you haven't turned off this crap yet, everybody is mysteriously gone (hint,hint) and all retarted crap happens from then on. zombies with red eyes, some dude who stalks them the whole friggin time and.. thats really it. they do stupid s**t like split up, go into a deserted house (familar?) and the rest is history. Kids with no experience with weapons are all of a sudden pros, Kung Fu fighters, and everybody is willing to kill themselves to save the pack. And the producers are on such a tight budget (apparently) they show video game clips once every minute... cool huh?Watching this film might be fun when you want to kill yourself... and when the movie ends... you really start to think WHAT THE HELL?Basically this movie would be the worst I've ever seen,but they show a bunch of topless babes, and a lot of blood. Zombie fans should avoid this at all costs.

Yes, this movie is awful. And if you are reading this it most likely means that you have a)read other reviews and/or b)have watched the movie yourself. If you have, I truly pity you for it IS the worst movie ever made.1."The Greastest Rave of the Century" is completely deserted: but that's alright, we have booze, woot. 2.Apparently, instead of having a continuous boat-service to transport people from and to the rave (everyone knows "raves" don't actually have a beginning, a middle and an ending) there is only a single raft. 3.The characters. Plain awful. They go from sobbing teens to killer machines in about 5 secs. 4.All the ammo that is too conveniently at their disposal. 5.The historical background that does not actually add anything to the plot (no wait, there IS no plot. My mistake) 6)A way too long shooting Matrix like scene with SO many errors it is staggering, undercut by the famous video game-footage and the even worse techno beat. To show just how awful this movie is, there is a scene in which a character that has just been disfigured is all upset over what people will think of him, now that he is ugly. While the whole crew is being attacked by mad man eating zombies. Would anyone actually be very worried about a scar, take the circumstances?Worse of all...the ending hints at the possibility for a sequel.

I avoided this movie simply from what everyone told me. It was on cable last night and i checked it out. This is without a doubt the worst movie ever. You think even a mindless idiot like Uwe Boll could give this some redeeming quality in terms of action but nope. The action was just horrible. I thought that the action sequence showing them try to get back to the house and they all have guns equipped had to be the worst action scene of all time. I watched it and it made me laugh so frigging hard. Come on all they had to do was blast a couple out of their way and get to the house, instead they waste just about every piece of ammo on idiotic wanna be bullet time sequences and showing heads explode. Could have worked but not here. Horrible. Horrible. Just plain bad. Man their is nothing else to say but this movie, well, it sucked and deserves to sit in the lowest pits of hell.

I like it because i first watch it on TV in 2005 on movie one me and my brother watch it i loved it i don't see why people hate it after i watch it 5 days later i hired it and watch it again it is mad the fighting is cool the zombies are cool the story is cool and i still don't get why it is in the bottem 100 it should be out of hear it should have a hire rating then this. maby the zombies are the same on 28 days later which came out a year before but i love house of the dead and nothing will change that OK so if you hate the movie you are a very sad person OK so if you hate it watch it again and you may see it is OK got it

reviews.review_title: Wanted to love it. Hated it.
reviews.content: I don't think they could've butchered the game worse... Honestly, you have to TRY to make a zombie movie this bad. I'm not sure what part was the worst! The acting, maybe... The special effects, maybe... The music, maybe... The plot, you get the point. I'm all for gratuitous nudity, but the scenes here don't even pretend to have a point. Think mowing the lawn topless, THAT pointless. I don't know how you can take a movie that has moron college students+zombies+an island and go this horribly wrong. Seriously, only rent this movie if you HATE zombie movies, because you'll walk away from it even more certain that they're unwatchable trash. Which, sadly, this movie is and then some.

The first rule of Zombie Flicks is - we do not talk about House of the Dead.The second rule of Zombie Flicks is - you DO NOT talk House of the Dead.Third rule of Zombie Flicks, if someone makes a really bad movie we do not make a sequel.Fourth rule, if you have to make a sequel don't plan on making another 2.Fifth rule, one bad zombie Flick at a time, fellas. Sixth rule you have to watch this movie with no brain. Seventh rule, House of the dead sequels will go on as long as they have to......And the eighth and final rule, if this is your first time watching House Of the Dead...rinse your eyes with water immediately then find medical assistance.

reviews.review_title: This makes from Justin to Kelly look like gone with the wind
reviews.content: I usually go easy on horror movies when i have to give them a mark out of ten some have been good like Dawn of the dead,Texas chainsaw massacre and i gave them eight's but this unholy conundrum of a motion picture doesn't deserve a two. Firstly the ghosts or zombies or what ever the hell they are look like characters from Barney and friends who just had a heroin overdose the actors should be shot for acting like there also on drugs and try to scare an audience with there acting.i guess the budget for this god awful piece of crap would have been just under a buck overall go see Dawn of the dead or the Texas chainsaw massacre than this crap and if you think that after reading this you thought that the monsters in this film are creepy,eerie etc or the movie itself you thought was scary and think I'm wrong then i recommend the polar express for you will be jumping out of your seat and having nightmares for a year 1/10

why people keep on saying that this movie was good??i saw it an i couldn't stop laughing.a stupid group of teens give 1500$ to a guy to take them to the island where there is a great rave and when they arrive there they don't see anybody and the first thing they do is drinking beer like it was a great party. the guy who paid 1500$ is happy too to see that he paid so much money for nothing.then they start being attacked by zombies. the zombies are everywhere but they decide to split (why?). the sailor saves them and gives them tons of weapons. the group passes from a bunch of scared kids to a superhero group. they decide to go into an house but there are hundreds of zombies. they kill them all with a part that was so bad that i could believe it. they start dying, one on one and two of them are saved. the end.but it isn't all...WHY did they put images of the game "house of the dead" in the middle of the movie? WHY did they say that it can have a sequel for "that" thing??? well my conclusion is: if you want to laugh a lot, watch this movie, if you are expecting a scary movie, don't watch it in any way!!!!!

reviews.review_title: The dead walk... you eject the DVD...
reviews.content: This contains a summary of the plot and contains spoilers! I took a sickie off from work and took a trip to the video store to see if I could find a zombie movie to pass the time."Oh, House of the Dead, huh? Yeah why not?" Now I know why not.OK, so the basic story is that a group of teenagers want to go to the "rave of the century" that's set on the island of death. They miss the main ferry and bribe Jurgen Prochnow and his cheesy sidekick Clint Howard ("It's eeeeevil!") to take them to the island (with Clint Howard getting flashed some rack on the way).They get there are find the rave to be deserted.So what do they do at a deserted rave of the century that's abandoned and only about the size of my backyard? Why, half of them start partying, and the other half have a look around to figure out what's going on.It's gets dark quickly and a couple that decided to stay start making out, but the guy decides he needs to take a leak first. This is when the chick get attacked.I don't think it's coincidence that it's at this point when a character goes to the toilet, that this film also goes down the toilet with the full flush button held down.During the film, and throughout, short clips from the HOTD game are spliced into the film for no reason. Maybe to just remind us that it's a remake of the game, b/c otherwise you really wouldn't know.The group meet up again (minus the attacked chick) and look around some more. They find a house. They go in and find other "partygoers" complaining that the "rave of the century" was, like, totally trashed and stuff, man.By this time, the group includes an Asian chick in a stars and stripes skin tight outfit called Liberty (yes you read right), a George A Romero fan (shameless attempt at film street-credibility here), an underwear model, Ona Grauer and her ample chest, a coast guard armed to the teeth (why not?) and some other people I don't care about.After travelling to the wharf to find the "Boat that wasn't there" (3rd favourite line in the film) to escape the island, zombies with bad make up attack!!! Liberty gets molested by one of them, but no worries, Jurgen Prochnow guns down all bad make up zombies and all is good again.He even shows them a stash of guns he was smuggling and the group gets armed and dangerous.So they journey back to the aforementioned house which is surrounded by zombies.Now here is where it gets flat out stupid. They start gunning down the zombies in bullet time and Liberty suddenly discovers she knows Kung Fu.This whole action sequence is annoying and the laws of physics fly out the window. None of the ravers miss a single shot (even though it's the first time any have used a gun), and as I said with Liberty, they all all-of-a-sudden know Kung Fu.It's obvious that many of the zombies here were the same zombies gunned down before. Also, some of these zombies are ninjas. Classy.Oh, Liberty dies while another guy looks on with a montage playing and the editing guy loving his job too much.They finally make it to the house.They barricade the door and my second favourite line in the movies emerges. Upon the underwear model finding an old book, he says "Hey, this book is really old. Maybe it can help us." Script, glorious script!! Yep, that full flush button is still being held down Some drama unfolds when one of the chicks says she thinks the underwear model is still attractive even though half of his face is covered in bad "I got acid-burnt" make up.Jurgen Prochnow is dying at this point so he logically concludes he should venture outside and blow himself and the front door up. So the zombies storm in, and the party retreat deeper into the house. But not before underwear man does the typical-stand-around-and-hesitate-when-yelled-at-to-move routine and gets attacked and blows himself up too.The party is reduced to 3 at this point and the venture deeper into the bowels of house. After having used up all their ammo before, an absence of bullets doesn't stop them from shooting more zombies anyway, but another chick dies in a pointless "Don't worry I'll handle them!!" scene.Ona Grauer and her ex boyfriend remain at this point and push on.They stumble into the lair of the main bad guy, and he tells them about his plan to reanimate the dead to achieve immortality. Hence is presented my favourite quote of the film when asked why he wants to be immortal: "To live forever" he says.Oh, Joyous script!! Anyway, they fight and an explosion goes off.Here is the only redeeming part of this film. Ona Grauer runs outside and you get a nice slow mo of her fun-bags bouncing around while she dives away with her bf.Ona is stabbed and the bf survives after a useless sword fight with the bad guy.And the movie finally ends.The only way to enjoy this film is to have subterranean expectations and switch your brain off. Abysmal script, toilet-esquire acting (they look like they were reading cue cards as they went), rubbishy action and plot holes aplenty.This film could maybe be fun it if was a spoof, but Uwe Boll takes himself seriously and thinks really he's a genuinely good filmmaker. This film just doesn't make sense and reeks of incompetent film-making.

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll should be in jail after this.
reviews.content: If you want to see what a cinematic piece of dog barf looks like, go see House of the Dead, otherwise do yourself a favor and play the video game, it's far more entertaining. House of the Dead If movies were cars, House of the Dead would be the back-firing K-car with the scrapyard windshield and a rag for a gas cap. It's a patchwork of poor acting, poor editing and even poorer writing. It's a video game adaptation in every sense and, in case you forgot, the filmmakers remind you by flash cutting scenes from the actual video game during the film! It's only saving grace was the action sequence three quarters into the film that has some fun special effects  it's so bad it barely falls into the so-bad-it's-good category. A band of idiots and a take-no-prisoners go-go dancer (?) end up on Isla del Muerte for the rave of the year only to get eaten by the "re-animated homo sapient" of a centuries old priest who was banished to the island from Spain for creating a death-cheating serum. If you want to see what a cinematic piece of dog barf looks like, go see House of the Dead, otherwise do yourself a favor and play the video game, it's far more entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie until the son of the mask
reviews.content: This is the lamest excuse for a movie... Heck, I don't even think I could call it a movie because more than 60% of this movie contained scenes from the game.... Don't see this steaming pile of dookie. The zombie fight scenes were never really shown because every time something got blasted, it showed something from the game, most likely a zombie scratch on the screen. Any time a character in the movie died it would show a rotation of that character and I think it said game over, I can't remember. It was one of those movies that I rented where I went to the kitchen and made a sandwich, then I talked on the phone, then I drove to the corner store for some cigars, and I never pushed pause once.

Good points So bad you can only laugh because it is actually meant to be a serious movie. Bad points The plot - until the last 20 minutes of the film there is no plot, its just random nonsense, the action scene was ridiculously long and boring, am I really expected to believe that a bunch of party goers are skilled weapon users, seriously come on.The Characters/Acting - You get a brief run down of a few characters at the start of the film, during the course of the film that group expands, as people are inevitably killed off, the little to no emotion at the loss of friends.Cinematography - wasn't all bad, but the flashing between action scenes was harsh on the eyes.Writing - Plain old crapOverall - 1 hour and a half of your life you will never get back

This movie is so boring. The effects look totally fake and the whole story is is just...ugh! I mean come on, a group of over-sexed teenagers go to an island with some freaking stupid curse that awakes the dead blah blah blah. I think that this movie is way to over rated. This movie only reached this score, because of guys who appreciated the "gals" as I might say. The actors just couldn't act, not even if there life depended on it. Most of the bad horror movies have a little humor, but here..nothing! Also a stupid thing it's called: House of the Dead. It's an island for crying out loud! Was it that hard to change the name so it would fit the movie!? To bad I can't rate it lower.

Let's say that you were to buy 'House of the Dead' on DVD. After buying the popcorn and drinks and inviting your friends 'round for a "great night of horror!" you turn the DVD on. Now instead of the movie you thought you were going to watch, you were attacked by an exploding fetus with needles, you would still gain better value for money than watching any Uwe Boll movie in existence.The human language has over 250 000 words in existence, yet none of them would provide an adequate description for just how bad this movie is. Just by viewing the sheer stupidity of the script and the horrendous acting involved, you're killing your brain, and quite possibly your sperm.You see, Uwe Boll adds a special ingredient to his movies, that when watched, your eyes absorb a chemical emitted by the film that makes it's way through your body, to wage war on your sperm. Okay, I'm just kidding with you.Now, back to business. Much like the Abskani in Alone in the Dark, the Zombies in this suck. For example, in one scene, where the "heroes" of the story are making their way through a graveyard of some sort (yes, I know. They're being attacked by Zombies, but still insist on taking a midnight stroll through a graveyard), they are ambushed by hundreds of zombies, each carrying axes or some kind of weapon. Now, as ridiculous as that may sound, you're in for more. In a sort of tribute to the video game, the scene pauses on each actor and does a 360 camera spin around them in slow motion. What point this serves to the plot, I don't know. And in a further disassociation of reality, a zombie, have decayed, runs, yes runs, full speed and then, hand in hand with stupidity, does a forward flip and launches an axe towards the actress. Yeah, I lol'ed.Now I could go on and on all day about just how bad this movie is, and how much I hate Uwe Boll, and how surprised I was to learn he has a doctorate in literature, but I can't due to time constraints.In conclusion, House of the Dead is as connected to the original video game as Jesus H. Christ is Scientology. If you're looking for a cheap laugh then by all means, watch it. However, you'll regret doing so afterward.

reviews.review_title: Shame that I can't give this movie a -5 rating.
reviews.content: I watched this piece of garbage on cable TV while nursing a bad case of the 'flu. If I was feeling well, then my time would have been much better spent doing something a lot more constructive. Watching this movie certainly didn't make me feel any better. I only tend to watch trash like this when my physical defences are down.One particularly annoying aspect of the movie was that young blonde woman in the tight dress. She was the one who was referred to as: 'PURE EYE CANDY'. Give me a break. Her constant giggling and idiotic behaviour really got on my nerves.Oh well, at least I didn't pay money to rent or buy this crap.'Nuff said.

reviews.review_title: I read all the reviews and thought I was prepared, but...
reviews.content: I got fifteen minutes into this one and felt COMPELLED to join, and let everyone know, it's WORSE THAN YOU CAN IMAGINE. I'm stunned. Who ARE the people who paid for this?!!?! I though if I was drunk enough, it would be fun, but cringing in pity isn't my idea of fun. I swear, I tried so hard to enjoy this one, but any more booze, and I'd go blind...How does a rookie team of movie-makers get such a pile of filth distributed?I'm offended they let this out. I swear, any human, including you or me, could have made a better movie out of this concept.Lois Lane topless gives it a 4 out of 10, which normally would make it, like, a 12 out of 10, but, dear God in Heaven, this movie is just SO BAD.

I am not sure how this guy gets to make films. Every film he makes is just a bunch of "good looking" young people horrible miscast in a sequence of special effects scenes stolen from other films. I can not think of a single feature of this film which validates it's existence. Possibly the most hideous part of this film was the slow rotating shots of the cast members when they did.. well.. anything. Oh and the fact that they all knew how to use weapons which they would have, most likely, never seen in their life. To me this kind of film damages genres such as horror and science fiction and gives fuel to the critics of science fiction in general. There has to be some way we can stop this guy making movies.. please let there be!!!

reviews.review_title: It is so bad that you can't even write a review bad enough to justify it
reviews.content: OK, I know that there are a million threads on this, but I couldn't resist. I consider myself to be a pretty big movie buff so I watched this movie last night. I knew that it would be bad. I am on this site every day and everyone talks about how bad this is. I, however, wanted to see it anyway for educational value. I see all of the top 250 movies as well as the bottom 100 movies just to see them. You can think what you want about that but that is besides the point. I like corny movies, I find them comical. I like zombie movies. With this in mind I thought that maybe I would enjoy this in a corny B movie kind of way. Boy was I way off. This is top 5 worst movies I have ever seen and I have seen a lot. This was so terrible I couldn't believe it. All of the reviews on here that I have read don't even give it justice. It is so bad that you can't even write a review bad enough to justify it. Everything that could go wrong in a movie has gone wrong here. The acting and story, or lack there of, were horrible. The Director should be shot. I know everyone hates Uwe Boll, but I ask how a man like this becomes a Director. I have no Director experience what so ever and I am positive that I can do better than this. I can not believe this was made. The best parts of the movie were the video game sequences (sarcasm). Who decided to throw those in? They should be banned from movies forever. I think that we should start McCarthyism all over again and black list anyone who had anything to do with this movie. To sum up in a few words: No matter how much you like to laugh at B Movies, this is too bad for even that kind of enjoyment. Stay away.

reviews.review_title: Please do not waste your time....
reviews.content: As one of those people who does not necessarily listen to reviews, I decided to try this one out for myself. You get the feeling that the idea for the film rested mainly on exposing mammaries and the need to provide employment for several extras, while the plot and script was scribbled on a Post -It note. The prolonged fight sequences, with a naff rock soundtrack, the emphasis on such cheesy lines and clichés eg: the Isle DE la' Morte, sexy girls in distress and part nudity, should be funny, but they are not. Possibly the crew wanted this to be a "so bad it's good film", and in that they failed. Please, as a spoiler, know this film is dire and a waste of your life when you could be watching a film like Undead, which is a well crafted and funny piece.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: Wrong is all I can say about this movie, I use to play house of dead with my older brother every other weekend on video game stores; It isn't the best game its just a simple shooting game that goes through a line plot and some maniac pretend to use this plot to make a movie. I know that movies based on video games are bad with capital B, however I didn't know when my brother rent it, I was going to watch the worst movie I have ever seen.Since the beginning you will realize how wrong everything goes, first the main plot: young people goes to a party to have fun on an island then the monsters appear and attack everyone, it's a copy of 80s terror movie that it isn't scary anymore. Second the actors, they were so bad, it was like the porn actor without any soul in their performance. Third the dialogues were so lame; the writer was like 16 years old. Forth the makeup was so fake; you almost see the glue in the injuries. Sixth the edition was horrible; at one moment the character has a gun and the next a knife and the next it is just running, I think the editor was blind or something and was editing with sound effect. And finally the gyratory camera I was like, what were they thinking? They abuse with this camera, they use everything with this angle, when someone was walking, Boom the gyratory camera!, when somebody shot guns, Boom the gyratory camera!, when somebody die, Boom the gyratory camera! House of dead has so many flaws that barely call this junk a movie, definitely the worst movie I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: An insult to horror movie fans (and to viewers in general)
reviews.content: I like House of the Dead (VG). It has not a brilliant story like metal gear for example, but I spent hours playing (and wasting money on) it.When I saw this title, I decided to give it a try. The game story was interesting enough and, after all, there were zombies and creepy creatures on it!! I must admit I didn't expect this movie to be outstanding, but neither did I expect to be like this. Sometimes we complaint about movies without being objective, because we didn't like this or that, and other viewers can think different. This is the one movie where this rule doesn't apply. The movie sucks, it has no plot (even the game had a better plot, and you were shooting things 99% of the time), the jokes are not funny, the actors seem retarded, but the worst is that for the first time in my life this movie gave me the impression that the director was insulting me and my intelligence (I don't know how to explain it in other way). It seems like the guy is laughing his ass off in front of all the fans of the game (if any) and all the people who paid something to see his "work".Don't get me wrong, I'm a fan of horror movies, and I'm accustomed to bad movies (in fact there are few good horror movies out there) but this one crosses the line of RESPECT towards the viewer. Other directors at least tried to do something right, this man tried to do everything wrong and insulting, and I must admit he excelled at it.Many of you might guess (correctly) that English is not my home language, and I apologize for the mistakes, but Im taking the burden so at least one person can avoid wasting money and (especially) time on this (spanish) "mierda" :).

Midway through this movie, a character we've never seen before and could not possibly care less about is trapped inside a knocked-over portable toilet, then killed off minutes later. That pretty much sets the tone of the entire movie.I'm sure the credits say differently, but it seems like most of this movie was written by a group of 14-year-old boys with mild learning disabilities.Why does a group of twenty-somethings with no apparent martial arts training (exception noted below) have the combat skills to fend off dozens of attackers, many of them armed? When they come across a convenient cache of firearms, why are they able to accurately shoot moving, leaping targets? In some recent zombie movies, the monsters are faster and more agile. In House of the Dead, it's fairly obvious that the "zombies" are just stunt men with a few pounds of latex makeup caked on their faces. Do the stunt men know they're portraying zombies, or are they just jogging after the protagonists? Why do all the sets look like they were recycled from an amusement park ride? Why does the only Asian-American character seem to have superior martial arts abilities? Why does the only black character sacrifice herself to save the white protagonists? Sometimes bad costuming and makeup can be excused if it's only shown briefly, or from a distance. Here, we're treated to repeated closeups of makeup that resembles the kind you'd see on those $1.99 greasepaint kits the supermarket sells around Halloween. We're shown extreme closeups of fake chain mail that's obviously sequined cloth. And the camera lingers on it for ten, fifteen seconds.Speaking of makeup and costuming, it's good to know that your hair will still look good after savage gun battles and strenuous hand-to-hand combat.And why are they flashing shots of actual video game footage during the movie? Couldn't they just flash an image of a guy throwing away eight bucks? I kept having Torgo flashbacks whenever they showed that bearded fisherman in the yellow rain slicker. While no attempt was made at character development -- or any kind of characterization for that matter -- having this guy in the movie was particularly bad.Technically, I don't think this is really a movie: it's more of a delivery device for action, special effects and brief nudity.

Wow this is THE worst film I have ever seen, and believe me I've seen a lot crap but NOTHING compares to this. First the story doesn't make any sense at all, second the acting is horrible and third if you're expecting a horror movie, you chose the wrong film to watch. But on the other hand if you would like to have a nice laughing time with you're friends you can go and rent this movie. But then a again this movie is so weird you would after a short period of time stop watching and go do something else with your time. So avoid this movie at any cost because it can hurt your soul and leave you hollow and asking yourself why did I ever rent this stupid movie...

I went to see this movie at the theater expecting something really bad and it was way worst than my expectations. The theater was already half empty after 30 minutes their was 20 people left after an hour the theater was empty.WOW !! I dunno where to start but this movie was by far the worst ever. It's crap the movie was 90min long watched 60 min and it felt like it was 200min! Worst than garbage is now House of the Dead. And what was up with them showing video clips of the game during the movie !?! The game was already horrible they had to add it in the movie. This movie made the movie Venom a masterpiece. Anyways it's simply worst than garbage wait I mean it's a House of the Dead!!

Wo-wo-wo-wo-woah! This is one truly laugh out loud comedy. That 360 degree spinning of the camera, all that cheesy blood and guts, the non-stop action. Incredible. And those cut scenes from the actual video game? Genius. Uwe Boll is one incredible director. So what if the characters are cardboard cut-outs? So what if the dialogue is silly? And the plot? Who cares about the plot? Plots are overrated. What really makes a great movie is great action and revolutionary 360 degree spinning of the camera. What an awesome film.Okay, enough of that. Only in an alternate universe will this piece of horse manure be considered an actual movie, let alone a good one.

reviews.review_title: Bad, and not even in the fun way just...bad.
reviews.content: House of the dead truly is terrible, but not so terrible you can't finish watching it. Nor is it really any worse than most zombie movies being made. It get's a bonus point for having a giant sega banner, and I love how in a half baked attempt to some how tie this to the games they just through footage of the games in for NO REASON. I guess they wanted something to set this apart from the million other bad zombie movies. This was really a great sign of things to come from good ole Boll. Still as bad as this is it doesn't deserve to be nearly this high on the list. The list seemed pretty screwy in general though what happened to all the 50s filth?

Oh, God. Words can't even begin to describe the crappiness that is "House of the Dead". Folks, if it's one deciding factor that has you teetering between the delicate balance between respecting Uwe Boll's efforts to create cinematic masterpieces, and totally wanting to punch him in the face for bastardizing what would otherwise be a PERFECTLY FINE VIDEO GAME ON ITS OWN, seeing this movie will have you sliding down the former because hell if I didn't want to deck the guy after seeing this.You can tell a movie is bad when the beginning narration comes from a dead guy. I wish I could remember the first line of dialog when the movie began, but it was just so corny and stupid I'd be surprised if anyone hasn't suppressed it into the deepest corner of their memory. Besides the crummy dialog though, which continues to get more awkward and overplayed by equally crummy actors--oh, wait. That's where I was going next with this review. Yeah, the actors all kind of suck in their own right, however, I can't say I really blame them. Imagine being asked to cast in one of Uwe Boll's movies and being desperate and poor enough you ACTUALLY have to do so. I feel bad for them all, really. Well, except for the guy that played the fisherman's annoying boat boy. Man, I hated that guy. His acting is some of the worst that you will ever see in the face of acting history, and that's kind of saying a lot since his role is pretty minor.Anyway, as far as the plot and script or lack thereof goes, you're pretty much better off imagining there was none in the first place, since the given script and plot makes absolutely no sense and would be completely--and, pardon what I'm about to say here, I mean no offense to those who actually suffer mental deficiencies--retarded even if it did. From what I could gather from it, the movie was about some 40 year olds wishing they were still in their 20's wanting to travel to obscure island in the middle of nowhere to go to some lame rave that, for whatever reason, takes place in the middle of the day. Insert actor guy #1, who is supposed to be the suave, collected jerk of the group given that he has the most hideous blonde bimbo attached to his arm like a leech, blabbering on about how much money he has. He talks to some captain about taking his boat to this island which supposedly has some weird voodoo going on about it. Insert a blur of crappy acting, droning dialog, and whatever else you see fit here. The kids go the island, something-something happens, then zombies appear. Like the typical zombie, they are hungry for living people, and so they chase after the kids in their $10 wal-mart costumes and pretend to be scary for a while.I don't like talking about the movie because it makes me remember how much I wanted to kill myself throughout watching most of it. It was terrible. Even if you're a connoisseur of crappy movies and buy these kind of films for twisted entertainment, believe me House of the Dead is NOT worth adding to your collection by any means. Save your money for good crap, like, say, The Scorpion King. House of the Dead is a waste of time and money.

Horrible, even for an independent film. Bad editing, bad writing, bad acting, bad directing. This movie was just...... horrible. I've also seen Bloodrayne, and thought it was just as bad. And now I hear Uwe Boll wants to direct Metal Gear Solid? No way in hell would Hideo Kojima let that happen. Personally, I feel that Uwe Boll is a terrible film-maker who produces terrible movies to make money. Then he turns around and challenges his critics to a boxing match? Please, like boxing people will make them like your movies better.All in all, Uwe Bol shouldn't be allowed to direct ever again. And sorry if this review strayed to far from House of the Dead, but i feel that everybody should know how terrible Uwe Boll is as a director.

After witnessing the horrible film I demanded a refund....from the cable company. I saw it on Sci Fi while I was sick and bedridden. Tragically for me I was as weak as a kitten or I would have walked out of my own house to avoid accidentally seeing parts of this movie while skipping thru channels. I somehow managed to sit thru it's entirety, I guess it was kind of like a train wreck, you know you shouldn't watch but you can't turn away. The horrible action sequences actually used clips from the game, there was WAY too much use of stop motion 360 degree matrix style cinematics, and the dialogue was the worst I've ever heard. Characters that "wish they were Foxy Brown" or being named Liberty and wearing a gaudy stars and stripes motif Lycra suit, naming them CPT Kirk?!?! Everyone becomes instant kung fu masters the moment they're pursued by the incredibly fast and agile "undead", then become expert sharpshooters and professional soldiers when CPT Kirk open his case full of guns. At which point there a dialogue exchange of "we don't have any food or guns" to which CPT Kirk replied ""we do now" then opened his box containing about 1 gun a couple flares and some random rounds of ammunition. Apparently the rest were invisible in the box because everyone had at least 2 guns the next time you see them. It was like a clown car only a gun box, things just kept coming out of it. I could go on but I'm getting sick again seeing the movie in my head.The fact that Uwe Boll is allowed to make films both astonishes and disgusts me. Anyone who would use fast action clips from a game released by Sega in 1996 to make a film in 2003 needs to have their head examined. So does anyone who would finance that person. I feel sorry for anyone that saw this movie and feel even sorrier for the cast, because after this bomb they were no doubt unable to find work.I guess Uwe Boll put out some kind of challenge where he would fight his critics. If I have to fight him to stop him from ever making another film, I'd consider it my service to the world. I'd rather challenge him to make something that doesn't make me violently ill, or at least something an elementary school AV club couldn't outproduce.If you want to see this I suggest to panhandle for some change and rent it so you don't actually spend your money. You'll need that for strong drink and probably some drugs if you plan of sitting thru this one.

Without question the worst movie ever made. Disgusting to think of all the movies that are NOT made, yet this crap gets funded just because the studio knows they'll be able to rip off yet again the same kids they ripped off by selling them the game. But make no mistake, this is not a zombie movie, it's a video game that you CAN'T PLAY! At least you can play a game, right?Whatever, think for yourself, but this is crap. Don't be fooled into thinking it's cult, and don't be fooled into thinking it's unintentionally funny, because it's not even that. In fact, the only reason I bother is in the hope that it'll do so poorly on DVD they won't bother attempting a travesty like this again. Don't buy the DVD, don't play it on the boob (you'll be the boob). And bloody hell, I LOVE ZOMBIE MOVIES. But this? This is toxic waste, toxic, stinking excrement.

I won't say what hasn't been said 4 million times by all the other reviewers but I had first downed a few weed brownies before sneaking into the movie theater to watch this piece of crap. The thought of the other people paying $13 each to watch this dog while they coulda picked a few other perfectly respectable films made me so full of mirth I couldn't stop laughing throughout the whole film. This is not just mere laughter at the bad parts, but crazy assed hurting my sides, friends moving away from me because they're so embarrassed, infecting other watchers with my laughter.. laughter! I think my laughter actually helped people enjoy the film more.. seriously.If you can truly enjoy a bad film.. at how much effort, money, and time was spent on this film by countless people.. at how somebody seriously thought this was a good idea.. whatever.. then this is a jewel. THE WORST FILM I'VE EVER SAW. and i've never laughed so hard in my life. the fact that it was filmed in Vancouver (my hometown) made it even better (and at the same time worse and more embarrassing).

I have grown a passion for horrible movies, and I was lucky enough to stumble upon this horrible director when this movie first came out. Uwe Boll is, without a doubt, one of the worst directors of all time. The plot, the cinematography, the characters and editing are all miserable. I have seen this movie probably four or five times, just like with his other awful film Alone in the Dark. The best recommendation I can give for this movie is that if you love to watch a movie that makes you laugh at its ridiculous plots and scenes, you will love this movie like I do. You will never think it is a great film, because as everyone who has seen this movie knows, it is not, but it is terribly funny. Awfully funny. After seeing this, everyone I knew was mad at me for making them see it. It is that terrible. Keep watching Uwe Boll, for he will surely continue to put out terrible video game movies that make me laugh and wish i could make celluloid spontaneously combust.

reviews.review_title: One of the Worst Movies of the 21st Century
reviews.content: House of the Dead is about a group of stupid teenagers going to an island which many people fear for a party. When they get there no one is there! So what happens? Zombies come out! So it's up to them and a cop and an old sailer to stop them! This low-budget piece of crap is so awful it's pathetic. This is another one of those horror cheapies about stupid teens getting killed. This is based off the Sega Arcade game of the Same Name. This movie has so much bad dialog I thought I was going to go deaf. The direction in this movie is awful. They used some of the game's kills as special effects. Do you know how old this game is? Just dreadful. Some of the dialog went like this...Stupid Cop Chick: You come with me Stupid Teen: What why? Stupid Cop chick: Have you been in a fight? Stupid Teen: Well uh... Stupid Cop: Ever fired a gun? Stupid Teen : Well I fired a... Stupid cop: That's why you.What was that?This isn't another one of those terrible movies where it's so bad it's hilarious. It's so bad you should blow up every DVD. Then the world will be happy!

This is without a doubt the worst zombie film, possibly the worst horror film i have ever seen. The whole film is unbelievably predictable. The actors are terrible. And the 'zombies' are more like excuses. They are not scary or intimidating in any way. The film looks like it has been home made. I cannot believe i watched this film. And about half way through i did stop it because it was that S***. I could go on about what happens and what makes it so terrible. But honestly its not worth it. PLEASE don't watch this! It is a complete waste of time.Thankyou for reading.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the worst movie I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I've been reading the IMDb forever, since back when it was on some University's domain, and I've never felt the need to throw my 2 cents in about a flick before.But my God. This one was something else.I really just want to say one thing. When they'd show bits of the video game between scenes, I thought that was really, really stupid. But after a while, I began to look forward to these bits, because they were SO MUCH BETTER THAN THE ACTUAL MOVIE.I also never rated a movie as '1' before. There was always SOMETHING that pushed a movie above the one. The hot Asian chick in the tight outfit was the closest thing that might have done the trick, but too little too late.And make no mistake; this is not a "so good it's bad" type movie. There's NO entertainment value to this one at all.

So you're telling me, during the entire shoot, not one person warned the director that he was making the worst movie ever? I have tried everything: taking the film as a joke, taking it seriously, getting hammered out of my mind and then watching it, but I still could not fathom the ensemble of the most untalented group of schmucks playing out a non-existent plot in front of me. Honestly, the director had to be up late at night, crying himself to sleep, knowing that he should be shooting infomercials. At the same time, the CEO's must have been crying themselves to sleep over why they gave their money to this dumb German. Talk about not knowing what's going on on the set; It's like the cinematic version of the Vietnam war! So, in conclusion, I am sorry Uwe, but this movie is complete "Boll." If I could give this movie an infinitely regressing negative number I would, but it's not possible, just like the film.

This was the first and only movie that I actually considered walking out of in the movie theater...Not only that the only other movie where I could hear everyone else in the movie theater saying the same thing...There was NOOOTTTHING GOOD about this movie. I love how these people are a bunch of party goers, and suddenly get their hands on these war weapons...but hey they are all experts and all know crazy martial arts...mhm...Bad Bad movie. The plot was horrible, the part with parts of the video game being flashed through out it...what the hell was the point of that??

It gets really bad.  The only half-way redeeming quality is the effects from the thousands of bullets used during the film.  There are context errors everywhere.  The acting is horrible, save Kirk.  The story is as holey as the grail, and the belief that the movie is a video game in itself just kills the movie, if it wasn't already a corpse.  So all in all it's a waste of your life.  I would have given this a zero had that been an option on the rating scale.

House of the Dead feels like it wants to be a combo of action and horror but it fails at all of its attempts to scare and fails at making you wowed by action. This all leads to a truly awful pacing where you don't care at all about anyone, your not scare, or invested or waiting to see what happens next. You just want this to end because you are bored beyond belief. The story is very basic and the one thing to credit this is there is at least a bare bone flow of story albeit filled with terrible storytelling elements the whole way but at least there is a plot and the camera is tuned on. This was beyond bad and I wouldn't recommend anyone watch.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen!!
reviews.content: The House of the Dead was the worst movie I have ever seen, between the pathetic 'matrix' 360 camera angle attemps and the cheesy acting I fell asleep. I don't think that the director and set manager could decide whether it was raining or not, because there would be rain on one side of the boat and not the other. I would rate this movie a 1 out of 10, (10 being the best, 1 being the worst). Also jumping scenes from the movie to the game was really annoying, it makes you wonder if they were just making up for lose time. I beg anyone who reads this, NOT TO SEE IT. It's not worth the time.

This film bypassed the big screen, and with good reason. I am a huge fan of zombie flicks, but all I did was cringe watching this.The zombies were far from convincing and the Matrix rip-off fight sequences did nothing to alleviate the poorly scripted plot lack thereof]. Even the cheesy Batman-esque scene segues of the computer game could not save this film. House of the Dead is approximately 130 minutes long, but just over half-way through my viewing, the DVD started to skip a bit and I did not bother trying to rectify it. Instead, I pressed the red button on my remote control.Six dollars and seventy-four minutes of my life I will never get back.

This movie was the worst piece of junk I have ever seen.  Take my advice, don't waste your hard- earned money on this travesty.  It was so bad, that I was speechless.  Not only that, those who see this movie and have never played the game, "House of the Dead", will think this is what the movie is all about.  My advice to you, play the game it is way better.

I once had the misfortune of watching this movie several years ago one afternoon after school because senior year is just that cool, you don't necessarily need to do anything worthy or constructive. And so we were flipping channels and I said "House of the Dead eh? The game sucks, lets see how bad the movie is." The game is entertaining, yea. The only purpose it serves is to entertain people before their movie is ready at the theater, but I suppose it does exist in standalone arcades (why anyone buys railshooters for consoles is beyond me). Unfortunately the movie was just rife with stereotypical zombie movie surrealities (Zombies are far more real than the acting and intelligence of this group of kids, and plot, would have you believe the actual living people are). It sucked, there's no need to even be specific. The entire time I just wanted the hot girls to do something interesting but even that didn't happen.If you ever have nothing to do and you catch this garbage on TV, watch it. You'll laugh for sure. It's worth watching for a bad movie to watch, such as Revenge of the Ninja.

Oh my goodness! I have honestly never seen so many people walk out of a movie theatre in history. There was a constant stream like a fast flowing river of people rushing down the cinema aisles! I stuck the movie out but just because I have a policy. The policy is to never walk out of a film - you never know it may get better. OK so that didn't happen on this occasion.For those of you who haven't seen this film, it is about a group of rich students who want to go to a rave on an island and it turns out there are a bunch of dead guys killing everyone. To be honest with you... that's about as far as the plot goes. The acting in this film is dire. It is full of poor one liners and cheesy lines. So many flaws: OK, these students get a lift with a fisherman who is wanted by this cop woman for smuggling weapons - SMUGGLING WEAPONS! He had 3 wooden boxes each with 1 gun in! They were going to what was supposed to be the biggest rave of the century - there looked like there was about 12 people there - I've had bigger garden parties!Before I saw this movie someone said to me - it's dawn of the dead meets The Matrix - how I laughed. The reference to the matrix is bullet time - really bad bullet time at that, and the reference to Dawn of the Dead is dead people. This movie had lots of killing of dead people - the fighting scenes were so messy - they were just a series of close ups all muddled up with some bullet time thrown in.I have a UGC Unlimited card so was not too riled by the fact that I saw this film however, I feel sorry for any paying cinema goer who paid six English pounds to see this drivel!

reviews.review_title: I just saw the premeire last night in S.F.
reviews.content: The Director, and many of the cast and crew members were there- including Clint Howard (excellent). They took my coolpix camera at the door, and I heard one of the crew say in German "blah blah  quicktime blah bla" I just wanted to get a picture with Clint.  The movie did look like it was shot in digital, which you will notice the first couple of minutes. I was very happy with the cinematography, the location was very lush. Veteran actor Jurgen Prochnow was great as the slippery boat captain. Newcomer Ona Grauer looks to be a promising new actress, She'll be a name to look out for. Clint Howard was excellent as usual.I'm not going to get into the story, but once it picks up,  It's a Gorefest in overdrive. Think Matrix meets Dawn of the Dead. The splatter FX were good. I noticed that Zombies in this movie were faster and more dexterous than in earlier Undead flics.Overall I'd say it was fun, if you don't take it seriously. I wouldn't put it on my top-ten list, but the packed audience cheered at the end of the movie.

reviews.review_title: A movie from the director that instills horror in gamers
reviews.content: This movie is HORRIBLE!The movie is based on a video-game series with the same name by SEGA, of which I have played House of the Dead II and III. Two games I would say are the some of the most fun to play light-gun games IF you have a light-gun to play them with (do not bother playing with gamepad, mouse or keyboard, trust me, I have tried). So despite the games having flaws such as bad graphics, minimalist story (there only for backdrop to the game), and really bad translations of the characters lines (f.ex. "Don't come!" when a girl is approached by a zombie), the lines are so bad some of them become really funny (unlike the movie). But amid all this the game was actually FUN to play, you know FUN? Like games are supposed to be. So a game is not like a movie, a game is supposed to be fun to play and does not need a story, it merely needs to be fun to play with, plots are unnecessary really.I was genuinely surprised when I heard of this movie, since the game series it was based on had almost no story to speak of, I mean the basic plot from the game was just loosely this: (this is from the game, not the movie, so no spoilers, sorry) You, a type of investigator/cop (It's and your partner are sent out to some town, you see zombies, you save some people, evil scientist and later evil dictator-type makes zombies using green stuff, you save the day. End plot. I really did not think one could make a movie with so little to base it on, so I was exited to be able to see how it would come out...I CAN NO LONGER PLAY THE GAME!!! Because it reminds me of the movie.This movie was so.. horrible that it hurts trying to think about it.The worst part is that I can not pinpoint what really made it so bad. The acting is mediocre, but i have loved films with worse acting. The scenery/props is/are nice and leaves no negative remarks visually (the style/condition of some of the props on tables remind me of Evil Dead for some reason). The location has NOTHING to do with the games. The characters are even less likable then the ones from the game. The plot is altered for the worse. And probably some other things I am currently suppressing from memory.Conclusion: DO NOT WATCH, it will ruin your chance to enjoy the games.

reviews.review_title: Almost as fun as a proctologist with a hang nail.
reviews.content: Several bad actor's in their early 30's attend a rave sponsered by fast moving kun-fu zombies.  Much funs ensues.  NOT!There were at least 7 people who just got up and walked out on this film when i went to see it.  Also, it was the first time I have ever found the people behind me talking to ADD to the movie.  And gee, it looks like someone got the ACME bullet-time in-a-box for Christmas!If ANYONE tells you there is a single redeeming feature to thsi film, they are trying to trick you.

reviews.review_title: If wasn't based on game, Would be decent.
reviews.content: Okay, I can see why people will find this movie, absolutely rubbish, however if this didn't have the random clips of the game and also if it wasn't based on the game it would properly be a lot better. Although it oozes cheese and has strange twists it isn't actually bad. The plot fits with the modern day, the Zombies were decent enough and the deaths weren't bad at all. As i said before i have rated it low because, the only reason it's based on a video game is to get publicity and help the movie get out there. If it wasn't based on the game i would probably rate it 4/5 out of 10.

House of the Dead was bad. Not bad ass. Just bad. They might as well have made a Pong movie... It was just horrid. There is no easy way to explain how bad this movie was. It was so bad that twice during the movie, the theater where I was at decided to stop the film by turning the houselights on... Perhaps just to see how many people were walking out... or perhaps just to help out those who were trying to leave... get out. Not only did the storyline bite chunky pancake dough... but the "actors" just weren't acting. The very first line in the movie kills it for everybody in the theater. You are NOT supposed to start a movie off by having a guy say "If only they wouldn't have come... they would still be alive"... You just don't say that. Sega... how could you?  You've made absolute fools of yourselves (Sega seemed to have sponsored the "Rave of the Year" where this whole thing took place).  And if you're going to make a movie based off a game.. please.. pleaaaaaaaaaase... don't use clips from the game within the movie. And if you're going to use bullet time... don't use it for more than a total minutes of 30 seconds in a fight scene. The only reason I can possibly think of for this movie being so insipidly stupid... was that they were trying to get the most mistakes for moviemistakes.com on opening weekend. One scene that really stood out was near the end. If you watch carefully, when the two 'survivors' are running out of the underground cave lab thing ... it's day... when the lab blows up a second later... it's night... when they show the two characters talking after that.. it's still night... but then when the evil dude comes running out after them.. it's day again. I've seen bad movies.. and I must say, this is the WORST movie I've ever seen. I knew something was wrong when the opening credits involved a Photoshop'ed (chopped? After Effects? nah.. most probably Videowave...) series of clips from the game itself. The only good thing about the entire movie were the boobie shots... and maybe the few little jokes that were "hidden" in the dialogue (dude to chick: "It looks like it's gonna rain.. we'd better get inside before we get wet" girl:"Too late...") Just.. don't watch it.. if you absolutely must watch a bad b-movie... watch House of a 1000 Corpses... atleast that one has a really nice execution scene.  As I understand... Alone in the Dark is being made by this same company.  Let's just hope it's not as bad as House of the Dead.  And if everything goes well... we'll have a Silent Hill movie on our hands soon.

I went to see the flick and all I can say is horrible.Don't even rent it. I was annoyed the whole time and it kept getting worse. The only good part about the film was the creativity to use the video game images through out the movie. Plus Mr. Cherry was cute enough to distract me from the whole concept of this....?(I don't even want to call it a movie)

reviews.review_title: don't try to hard to understand this film
reviews.content: this film is full of unanswered questions, they try to put a little tale to explain why the island is full of zombies. Like i said put your brain aside and enjoy the action and the killing. But i must say that the the pop-ups of the sega game all the time during the movie was for me very disturbing. But i must tell that i was entertained. If you like zombies movies, why not....

Surely the worst movie ever made!!! Everything is wrong: the plot, the dialogue, the acting... Every second of this movie is full of mistakes. The 'Matrix' scenes are awful. Every scene is a nonsense. How did the journal from that ship survived if that priest or whatever he was burned the ship? What was with the experiments he did on the island? That fish?! with teeth? And all those guns they had! It looked like they were ready to fight the dead! Incredible!!! Worst is a nice word for this movie. 1 is very big grade for this movie. So don't watch it! Don't lose a hour and a half of your life with it!

reviews.review_title: I've seen bad, but this wasn't even 'fun' bad
reviews.content: The plot (If you want to call it that) was derived from bits and pieces of much better (and better done) horror movies. I was expecting bad acting and there was plenty of it but the worst thing about this movie was the awful and overused camera tricks, like the 360 degree turnarounds, the instant replay of attacks, the frontal face close ups while running and the pathetic game screen cut-ins during zombie shootouts. I've already wasted my money and time on this piece of crap. Don't waste yours.

reviews.review_title: One of the 10 Worst Movies that I have ever seen!!!
reviews.content: This movie could have been SO much better - especially considering it's budget.  But instead, it wastes the viewer's time and money with lousy acting, a horrible storyline and only marginal special effects.This movie is horrible and a complete waste of everyone involved's effort.

This isn't even the worst movie ever. It was the worst pain ever. Not worth 1.00 rental fee. The game is much more entertaining. Not even the chicks made it worth it. I am filling up to the fourth line so this can be sent in. Much like the video game fillers in the movie. There's really nothing more to say about so bad a movie. Don't bother.

A group of models and doctors go to a rave on a haunted Spanish island off the coast of Seattle. (You know, all those Spanish islands off the coast of Seattle) Girls find themselves in situations where they are required to remove their shirts and bras and then bounce around, which may be the only redeeming quality of this movie if you're a male or a lesbian. Apparently you can also tell if it's going to storm by sticking your finger in your mouth and holding it in the air. Anyway, zombies bust up the rave, a plethora of weapons conveniently appear, and what feels like a half hour long matrix-y action scene set to repeating techno music goes on until I'm barely even paying attention anymore. Flashbacks to scenes hundreds of years ago are in grainy, sepia tone, as though they were supposed to have actually been filmed using old fashioned cameras, although it would have been about two hundred years before cameras were even invented. Screen shots of the video game appear once every ten minutes or so, which is distracting and annoying. Painfully predictable. My roommate and I were dictating everything that was going to happen twenty minutes before it happened. Great for a laugh.

reviews.review_title: BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD - And not in a Michael Jackson kinda way
reviews.content: Synopsis :- A group of happy-go-lucky teenagers head out to a remote island in the middle of nowhere for the ultimate rave party. Arriving too late to catch their arranged boat ride, they quickly search the harbor for someone else to take them. Stumbling upon a couple of rouge smugglers, they buy themselves a trip to the party  little realising it's gonna be one way! Once on the island they begin what they hope will be one of the best nights of their young lives  little realising IT WILL BE THEIR LAST!!! Mwah Mwah Mwah hahaha! Etc etc  As the audience, you sit there waiting patiently for a good film to unfold before your eyes, little realising Review :- You know when you see something so terrible, that even though you know you should look away, you can't stop looking? Cause it's so God-damn-awful!? This is one of those kinds of films. House Of The Dead is simply put  dreadful. It's the movie equivalent of a road wreck  only with more blood and less brains. If I were American I would exclaim 'Dude, this totally sucks ass', for it does and it truly is  awful. It joins 'The Principles Of Lust' & 'Catwoman' in my Top 3 Worst Films Of 2004. And here's why :- it sucks on every level imaginable  dude!It's not just the bad acting, horrid characters who annoy right from the start, ropey effects, zombies looking like they escaped from Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' video in 1983  and are still on the run. It's not even the stupid plotting which includes such dumb-ass moments as the only survivor of the film telling you that everyone else is dead in the opening 30 seconds (which means a you don't give a flying fungal seed about any of them, cause they're all annoying and you already know they all die  it's just a question of how and when, not if, so by default there is absolutely no suspense whatsoever). It's all of those + things such as lame inserts of the computer game the film is based on! Oh yeah, computer graphics look really cool up on a 30 foot screen  not!. Then there's another sequence which sees the kids go to the house where the dead come from, then later on when those who are left are running for their lives, where do they decide to hide and hold their ground? Down by the harbor in case help arrives? The far side of the island where there's no zombie infestation? Hell, the hill in the centre of the island where you can at least see all around you and defend from all sides?No  these dumb American stereotypes, which you don't give a crap about anyway, go straight to the house  THE HOUSE!!!!! Knowing full well the creatures are inside and the bloody things came from there in the first place! How dumb do the film-makers think the audience is? If it was done tongue-in-cheek, then I could forgive it, but it doesn't. The film takes itself waaaay too seriously and thinks it's a proper full-on action/horror. But it's not. But cue lots of shooting and mayhem in the most ludicrous (and overlong) action sequence of the year anyway.
