Stealing from The Matrix and every zombie flick you can think of (The poster screams the tag-line 'It's The Matrix Meets Dawn Of The Dead'  well it certainly steals from both and subsequently urinates over the legacy of both!), the group of scared teenagers suddenly discover they can shoot firearms as though they'd all done a ten-year tour of duty in 'NAM, and a couple of them (who'd been kacking their pants earlier in the film) are suddenly capable of martial arts moves that would make Bruce Lee think twice before tackling them. It is one of the most over-long, drawn out, boring action sequences ever committed to celluloid. You will laugh yourselves silly at the over-use of bullet-time (funnily enough it's the same tracking shot used each time!) as EACH character has their own 'Matrix' moment  the damn thing goes on for about 15 minutes and it's soooooo dull!Now, I am one for suspending disbelief but please even in horror movies there are certain rules. The one crucial ingredient missing from this film is FUN! With such a silly set-up it needs a sense of humour. But the cast all play it dead straight and because not one of them seems to have even graduated past The Junior School of Stage Pantomime Acting, none of them have the acting chops to make it work. You will cringe at the scenes when any of them try anything remotely emotional. In one particular scene one of the main characters watches in horror as his now zombie-fied girlfriend gets blasted twice with a shotgun  all he can do to show his grief is slap his forehead like Homer Simpson and bite his lip! Seconds later he's running around as though nothing had happened  oh yeah I feel your pain  pillock! When are you gonna die? Soon I hope.And the story  of yeah, well the story  there isn't one! It's just set-up, set-up, lots of running, death and a crappy voice-over ending, which God forbid, hints at a sequel. This is a truly appalling film - from start to finish it's an atrocity to movie-making. I wanted to walk out on numerous occasions during its short (yet feels painfully very long) running time. It makes 'Resident Evil : APOCALYPSE' look like 'Citizen Kane'. Please kill this wanna-be Resi-clone now and be done with it. Basing a film on a LIGHT-GUN game was a bad idea in the first place, but then to jettison the plot and storyline in favour of this load of nonsense shows the film-makers as the idiots they are. I've been informed that the games have a really good story to them, none of that is evident here. Absolute tosh, avoid this like a sailor with the clap.

House of The Dead was THE worst movie I've ever seen in my entire life!!!! As the viewer, I should have been paid 10x's the amount of money it cost to make this "film": 1x- to sit through this crap they call a film and 9x's- for the hour and a half that I wasted and can't ever get back.  It wasn't worth the $1 fee I paid to rent it for the day...in fact it wasn't worth the paper it was written on!!!!Please I beg of you, if you've rented this movie, DON'T return it, don't allow the next potential viewer to suffer like we have!!!!

I've seen a lot of horror movies in my time, but "House of the Dead" is probably one of the worst. I found it worse than "Feardotcom," if that gives you any inkling of just how vile and worthless this *ahem* "film" is. Right from the get-go the plot is stupid and nonsensical. A group of idiots pays $1500 to ride a boat to a rave? Yeah, okay. Couple the total lack of plot with the ridiculous dialogue, the inane action scenes, the jarring and annoying video-game cuts, and to top it all off, the least likable group of main characters EVER, and you get a totally unwatchable morass. I truly hope that the troglodytes involved with the making of this garbage are never allowed within shouting distance of a camera again.

Sometimes a film's reputation precedes it, but you decide to see for yourself just how bad it is.  House Of The Dead is that sort of film.  I knew going in that it would probably be of below average quality, but I had no idea just how ridiculous this movie would be.  From the horrid acting to the ludicrous dialogue to the bad accents, I was ashamed for whoever was responsible for this movie.  The ultimate camp effect was achieved by editing in frames from Sega's old video game upon which this film is based, it just looked that bad.  I thought those bits were to be edited out due to initial negative reactions?  At any rate, save your money and wait for the remake of Dawn Of The Dead if you're craving a zombie fix, there's nothing to see here.

reviews.review_title: The worst Video Game or Zombie movie ever!
reviews.content: This is by far the worst of both worlds for me I'm an avid video game player and a lover of zombie films and this movie makes a mockery of both. To start out I'll break down why this movie stunk as both.As a Zombie film - the film lacked gore the zombies although they were fast and able to handle weapons were dumb throughout the film you see them an arms length away and not attempting to react( it almost seemed like they were on a smoke break). Also this movie was not scary the typical jump moments that you expect in horror films is not there. and then there is the camera work and editing many times the characters will be holding one weapon and when they change camera angles there is a totally different weapon.As a video game film - the original house of the dead story was a great concept in gaming that could have possibly made a good movie. This movie, even though called house of the dead share's nothing with game except the title. There is also the constant flashes to the game during the movie as if to fill up space.So if you are looking for a good zombie film rent Night of the living dead, Dawn of the Dead or Day of the Dead. You want a good video game movie rent Mortal Kombat and if you want a good Video Game/Zombie movie rent Resident Evil but don't ever watch 'house of the dumb'.

One dimensional characters, with little to no likablity. Cartoonish live action, appropriately punctuated by video game clips. The plot and plot devices are such that you would fine in an episode of Scooby Doo. The special effects are tiring. It was cool when the matrix did it once or twice. But this movie does it 10 times in a row, it not only made me laugh - it made me dizzy. The only thing that could have made this movie worse would have been to make it longer. The babes were not exciting and the one who wasn't dressed skimpily was the only one who should have been.Bottom line: Save your money, and your time. Or if you want a really scary zombie movie see 28 Days Later.

This was by far the worst movie I have ever seen.  The storyline itself was actually not bad for a zombie movie, but it wasn't the slightest bit gory or believably scary, and the characters were ruined by actors and actresses who portrayed them.  All, in all, if you want to see a really bad movie this would be it.  The sad thing is that although it was awful, me an my friends could not turn it off after beginning it, no matter how bad it got we pursued it to the end just to see what happened!  I sure hope that ending doesn't indicate that they're going to have a follow-up in this selection. Thinking back to the most recent remake of "Night of the Living Dead", "House of the Dead" would undoubtedly score a zero, and what's worse is that Michael Jackson's "Thriller" was a more believable zombie flick than this movie :O

When my girlfriend came home with a movie I was somewhat excited, that is until I asked what movie she picked out. "House of the Dead", she replies. Are you crazy, don't you know that is on IMDb.com's top 100 worst list. IMDb, what is that she says. OH MY, here we go.So we watch the movie... after 2 minutes she leaves the room crying, knowing already what a disaster the night is going to be. I was having a good time.I couldn't believe anybody would actually want to work on this movie. My state of disbelief lasted about 10 more minutes, then I started crying too. I finished watching the movie to see if there was some sort of joke at the end. There wasn't, it turns out the entire film was the joke (and it's on you because you paid to see this nonsense).I would rate this film a -2, since watching me watch the movie would be more fun than watching the actual movie.two final questions:1) is the ship's cabin boy based on the Gorton's frozen fish guy, you know from the box??2) shouldn't I have gotten paid to watch this movie, I mean it is just a giant commercial after all!DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON THIS MOVIE, on no level is it entertaining. Mystery Science Theater 3000 couldn't even make it watchable!oh my!

Its completely sad and pathetic that reading the user comments and bitter soliloquies about HOUSE OF THE DEAD is waaaaay more entertaining than the damn movie! The movie WAS all of the things everybody has mentioned so far, and the video game was SO much better and had a more coherent/believable storyline. The inexplicable cuts to the video game, especially when the clips are from the future if you're trying to follow the story at all, were aggravating to say the least. I don't know how theaters work around the world, but I'm glad that I was able to get my money back, if not my wasted time. If you're a fan of killer tomatoes and Ed Wood then you MIGHT appreciate this schlock, but if you were looking for a good/decent horror movie, STAY AWAY!

reviews.review_title: If you like this movie, then I have no respect for your opinion
reviews.content: "Kids" in their early 30s go to the world's lamest rave, held in the ruins of Jurassic Park. They are then attacked by the world's lamest zombies, and fight them off using concentrated stupidity and bullet-time. Then there's a vampire pirate and a helicopter.People will try to justify this as a "Fun B Movie", "Something you aren't meant to take seriously" and that you should "Just turn your brain off and enjoy it".Despite the fact opinions are subjective and thus cannot be right or wrong, these people are still wrong. While it is certainly a B-Movie, it's not fun, and the only way to enjoy it would be to think "at least these people are never, ever going to work again", except that they probably will.The characters are totally bland cyphers who may as well be mannequins. This isn't "light" characterisation, it's non-existent characterisation, so I don't care what happens to them. Even when they should be scared or amazed - which the audience would at least relate to even if the characters redefine "2 dimensional" - the movie is too concerned with being cool to let us feel anything. There's so many bullet-time shots, video game clips (yeah, really), smug references to infinitely better movies and characters doing things solely so they can be put in danger that there's no truth to any of it; it's all soulless artifice that never progresses beyond the "A House of the Dead movie would be cool!" stage of its life.No feeling. No life. No soul. A void. See, those "fun B-movies" that people love to go on about as some kind of justification for supporting tripe like this... they might have had bad effects, laughable scripts and wooden acting, but the people involved were trying to make something entertaining. The people who made House of the Dead were going on a $12 million self-indulgent ego-trip, and clearly didn't care what the end result was because, hey, wouldn't a House of the Dead movie be cool? Answer: Possibly, if it was made by someone else.And, to cap it all off, they managed to take something as inherently cool as a VAMPIRE PIRATE, and then make him one of the most boring villains in history. If I made a movie, it would be about a vampire pirate killing the people who made this, then turning them into vampires so he could keep killing them. That would rule.Positive aspects: Topless women.Negative aspects: Everything else. You can also find topless women on the internet for free, and without supporting the makers of this film, rendering the only positive aspect moot.Don't be tempted to rent it because it might be so bad it's good. It's an infuriating pile of wank, and, combined with the recent "hits" Resident Evil and Underworld, has probably set horror back to the pleistocene period. If you could give 0/10, I would. Actually, I'd go lower.

Have you ever watched a movie and later wanted that hour and half back? I can sit through some really bad stuff just because I really like the genre. The Anime, horror and Sci-Fi film industry seem to bank on this with at least half the films they produce. This one ranks down there with Chupacabra and Vampires: The Turning. I knew it was going to be bad from the first five minutes of terrible acting and poor direction. The costume design was laughable and there wasn't a single funny, intense, or scary moment in the entire film. It was very predictable except for the part when the "hero" lets the female Asian character get killed without lifting a finger to help her. OK... so that part actually ticked me off. Add poor writing to the list.

reviews.review_title: This movie is not worth your time or money
reviews.content: I know very well that by giving this movie a 1 on the scale from 1 to 10, it increases the chance of making fans of bad movies watch it."House of the dead" is one of the most uninteresting, boring, horribly produced and acted movies that I have ever seen. A friend brought it last night and we were going to enjoy it. The joy ended as soon as the movie started. I am not going to give you any spoilers, but if you like zombie movies because you think they are hilarious, you will not find any of that kind of humour in here. It is just.. incredibly dull and boring. I am not going to comment on the actors *bites tongue*, as the producer mainly is to blame for this waste of time."House of the dead" is AWFUL, and I don't mean that in a GOOD way!

no one went into this one thinking "it just might be brilliance", but it was surprising in how disappointing it was. there were, what seemed to be, some attempts at playing around with the genre....like having the nude bathing woman live and the drunk boyfriend on the beach get killed.....or having the "Romero's holy trilogy" guy be the first off after we meet him...but seriously. the only problem i still have with this one is figuring out which was more ridiculous...the girl wearing the stars and stripes body suit named liberty, or the fact that no one ever, ever reloads a gun. i just feel bad for Clint Howard having to be in this. Poor Clint.

This movie is g*d awful-pitiful. This is definitely a movie to bash on. Everything from the actors, to the acting, the directing, and the script itself, is pitiful! If you are looking for any movie to watch, absolutely don't waste your time and skip this movie. I'd rather watch Gigli over this!The special effects are another disappointment; And for a horror movie (unless it is made back in the day) it should have more substantial effects throughout the movie. It takes a lot to make this bad of a movie, but this one takes the cake. In my opinion, the company which allowed this project to be carried out should be fined. It is not only a disgrace to the movie industry, but it shames the gaming world as well.PS. I've seen porn movies with better acting and screenplay than this movie.

reviews.review_title: Makes Gigli look like The Godfather
reviews.content: This is by far one of the biggest piles of crap I have ever seen. The acting was terrible and there were so many clichés it was ridiculous. This was supposed to be a horror flick but I laughed the whole way through it. The only reason this movie didn't make me want to burn down the director's house was Ona Grauer's cleavage. Other than that, this was a complete flop due to the terrible music, random video game flashbacks, horrible dialogue, and numerous other details that anybody whose IQ is above room temperature would know to leave out. One thing I would like to know is how and why the Spanish went to Oregon?!?!?!?! Do you have any idea how many supplies you would need for a trip that long? That trip involves going around South America and back up the coast of it, Mexico and most of the U.S. To sum it all up, this movie sucks.

I'm a huge fan of the game...playing it either single or dual guns makes my blood boil in excitement....too bad the movie produces the opposite effect...like most of the failed game-to-movie adaptations...it's flaw it's the poorly relationship with the game...no characters (besides Dr. Curien) no Rogan, no agent G, no James, no Gary, No Amy, no Harry no Goldman, no nothing of nothing. just another dumb teenager movie...and badly acted on top.summaryPlot: a copy of a any dumb-teenage movie acting: horrible make up: awful, those zombies don't look like the game's zombies by far mmmm...nothing else to rate

You know, it kept my attention. I was younger, maybe not too wise as to the pitfalls of Uwe Boll movies. I assumed that it would be a decent adaptation of House of the Dead; but found that it was nothing like the video game. I laughed so much during this movie, it was entertainingly bad. I still have it somewhere in my DVD collection, and if I ever need something to remind me that whatever I've written - nothing could be as bad as the dialog in that movie. I have a fondness for bad horror movies, I absolutely love some of them, and loathe others. Trying to approach a movie like this with the sensibilities of a seasoned critic will not work. Just sit back and accept that what you are about to see is not supposed to be in any way a 'good movie' just entertaining.

I went to see this film on halloween, Believing that it could be quite good. Alarm bells should have started ringing with the fact that i had never before seen it advertised. I came out of this film knowing that that was an hour and a half of my life I was never going to see again. This film could have had soo much promise, but obviously sega were only interested in making quick money. I am mad about horror films the tackier the better but this was abysmal.I feel sorry for the actors involved in it. The zombies themselves weren't actually that rubbish but, the filmmakers habits of using bullet time over and over again to try and pad out the film and use footage that they had already shown made the film unbearable. I have never walked out of a film before and i wanted to with this but thought that i'd already paid five pound fifty might as well wait see if anything good happens, it didn't. The filmmaker used the same techniques too many times that it was just irritating, they used bullet time for each of the characters in the space of about five minutes, yes thats a brilliant technique but not when it's used to that extent. This film was trying to be something it's not, GOOD! How many times do we need to see different people with no legs waggling about on the floor, this film was too repetitive. It is such a same as this could have been an excellent film but it just didn't seem to know what to do with itself, it was trying too hard to be the next resident evil or something it didn't work was it a comedy who knows who can tell all i can say don't waste your time and money seeing this film when you can watch paint dry. It really was the worst film i have ever seen and i have seen a lot of bad movies.

reviews.review_title: A waste of time and money.
reviews.content: This is not a film, but a pantomime. However at panto's you're able to laugh at, but this film was so unbearable we had to leave within the first half hour... and that was pushing our limits.The film is shoddily created, scripted, casted and all round painful to watch. Following all the guidelines of a "horror" film it was outrageously predictable and was completely unoriginal.The sets were poorly created (the classic bubbling and smoking mud pit with a rickity bridge crossing did make me chuckle) and the characters seem to have come straight out of a 'Scary Movie' film. They took this film way to seriously, if they made fun of the poor acting and script it may have been amusing to watch. But instead each line and action made me squirm.

This movie was the most horrible film I've seen. I've seen bad movies before that "knew" that they were bad movies and that made them fun to watch. This movie was trying way too hard to be something that it simply was not.The game that this movie was trying to adapt was more interesting even if you had to spend $20 in quarters to finish it. The storyline in it was better, and the graphics I'm sad to say were a lot better too. This does not help the game-to-film genre, if anything it hurts it more. Don't expect more from the next two movies that Uwe Boll is directing that are game adaptations (Alone in the Dark and Bloodrayne).Bad script, bad acting, bad directing, horrible FX. Don't lose 90-minutes of your life like I did. Now I have to die knowing that I have 90-minutes less because of this piece of crap movie.Thanks for nothing Uwe Boll.

This has got to be the worst movie ever made. When voting for this movie, I wish I could have given this a score less than 1/10. It was no surprise for me to find that it ranked in the bottom 100 on IMDb.I enjoy many zombie movies, so it's not that I just don't like the genre. There is honestly nothing good that I can say about this one. The acting and script was cheesy, especially the character on the boat that wears the yellow raincoat. I kept waiting for one of the other characters to throw him off the boat.They included clips of the video game it was based on at various points for no reason. Maybe they wanted to remind everyone that it was based on a video game ... Maybe they wanted to make the movie another five minutes longer ...I also found the zombie fight scenes to be extremely terrible. Several times they show the scenes in slow motion (a la The Matrix).Another annoying point is that the show the zombies grab a tree about 8 times in the movie. Why do that?If you want to watch a zombie movie, watch Shaun of Dead (10/10) or Dawn of the Dead (8/10). Both are excellent alternatives

reviews.review_title: extremely embarrassing, only the trailer was good.
reviews.content: extremely embarrassing, only the trailer was good. I wasted my time, money, and 2 hours of my life. I believe this movie ruined the actors, directors, and producers careers. I predict the reputation of this film will notoriously rival "Ishtar". a few of these changes and the film could have been salvaged . * Hire a new director, the film was just uwful.* hire better actors , the actors were not convincing.* hire better special effects crews, the full-circle shots was OK after the first two, but did it really need all of the characters (5 or 6?), and seemingly 3+ minutes of film time, my head was spinning. It obviously wasn't the same FX used in the matrix.* hire better writers. Word-to-self, if I'm stuck on a deserted island with only zombies, and my friend get hurt, I will not say "we should get him to a doctor". Like a doctor was going to "pop up behind a tree stump" or something.i seriously spent too much time writing this review. how this actually got on the silver screen is incomprensiable ! I felt the movie industry sink to a new low with this release.DO NOT go watch this movie.. Its a piece of crap. the lines are all cheesy and the acting sucksGOD! PLEASE GIVE ME MY TWO HOURS BACK!

reviews.review_title: I've got an idea for the sequel!
reviews.content: The only thing that could possibly be worse than this movie is if they made a version of Sega's spin off to house of the dead: "The Typing of the Dead".At least then there would be a reason for the stuttered editing, long unusual pauses in acting and ridiculous dialog. They might have well been saying "sheep shirt shop" for all the consistency of the plot.Amazingly poor editing Incredibly poor dialog This film has all the inherent life of a rotting zombie carcass.

A lot of reviews talk about how this movies plot is terrible since Uwe Boll made the mistake of porting it straight from a video game. This is actually only partially true. The plot is horrible yes, but the game its not. I'm not sure why Mr. Boll put in shots from the game to make it look as if he stayed true to the plot, since he really didn't at all. In the game the character was some sort of government agent trying to save scientists in a house full of zombies created by an evil genius. The sad part is, this premise is arguably much better than the abomination Uwe turned it into. He threw out anything that likened it to its virtual counterpart. My guess is he put in the clips just to remind gamers why went to see this piece of crap.

reviews.review_title: Worst zombie movie ever... The very bottom of the barrel
reviews.content: Stupidest movie I ever seen and believe me, I've seen a lot of bad movies. This isn't even a bad movie that's funny because it's bad, it bad plain and simple (even painful to watch really). The story is very basic and there is no such thing as suspense or unexpected events it isn't even scary. I particuliarly couldn't believe the scene where the teens go back to some sort of abandoned house on the island and they start to kill the zombies... the scene is on slow motion with cheap matrix like effects and it goes on for at least 5 long, very long minutes. This movie was apparently based on a video game (I don't know the title)and the producers keep flashing in-game footage throughout the film. If you're a Romero fan, avoid at all cost. If you're a stupid teen who wants to see gore and a few pairs of boobs... well I don't care. I sincerelly can't believe I paid to rent this...

When the cop lady is passing out the weapons with Captian Kirk, I found it to be the corniest part of any movie I've ever seen. I know some producers and writers like to jazz up their scripts by giving their characters Uzis and M16's, but this movie failed miserably. The cop lady takes out her "stainless steel" shotgun with explosive rounds and shows it off to everyone else. Then, Captian Kirk opens his crate where he has a "small" arsenal. The black chick reaches in and grabs a handgun, where after Kirk says "Desert Eagle, I like the way you think." After, we go through a small montage of each character reaching into Kirk's endless crate of weapons and taking something. They pulled out chain-linked bullets, but never a chain-gun. We see one of the characters take some grenades and strap them to her belt. It always surprises me that the US Army spends millions training its troops in proper grenade use but drunk teen-age girls going to a wave already know how. In fact, the characters in this movie strap themselves so full with weapons like sub-machine guns and TNT sticks but never really use them. This scene sucks all the masculinity out of guns that after when I was watching Scarface the last scene wasn't very exciting for me. "House of the Dead" is not only a movie that destroys itself, it also destroys every other movie you'll see. It a cinema-virus.

this movie could only be good if you have 12 years old, and as ironic as it can be it is restricted R. Really bad story, bad actors, etc. Trying my best at not being so negative, there are some boob scenes of some nice girls. But that would be the end of it. It says that I have to write a minimum of 10 lines for this to be an accepted comment, and doing that is already hard. filling in as also a closure. do not see this movie. it sucks. reviews.review_title: Warning: this film will give you intellectual diarrhoea
reviews.content: House of The Dead was the title of a famous video game developed by Rikya Nakagawa of SEGA. The game was designed as a first-person shooter, but what made it stand out from titles such as DOOM and QUAKE was that it was done in arcade format, known to many as the light gun, where rather than sitting back with a controller, the user can hold a gun within his/her own hands and try their best to survive against a horde of undead. This, along with the graphics, the obscene creatures and violence, made the game very popular. The story revolved around two government agents wearing trench coats investigating a mansion, where experiments conducted on zombies goes awry. Curiously, this came out at the same time with Resident Evil, which was more atmospheric. Now comes the film. Originally DreamWorks had the license, but later lost the rights, which were promptly bought by MINDFIRE's Mark Altman, who would serve as the co-writer and producer of this film. At first I was excited, for I loved Free Enterprise, which Altman had co-written with the director. Later, there were advertisements that showed a Robert Deniro-like zombie licking a girl's face, a scene that could have chilled the audience. However, after watching the film, this viewer, along with many others, emerged disappointed. The plot made absolutely no sense, the acting was poor, and although at times the creatures looked decent, Boll's lighting and directing made them laughable. What further weakened the film was the inclusion of video game footage and MATRIX shots, followed by scenes that were supposedly made to scare the audience. It's almost as if director Uwe Boll hadn't wanted to make a good film; rather, he just wanted to dazzle his audience. His interviews amusingly denied that it was a poorly-made film, making both this garbage and Boll even more pretentious than one would dare to attribute. As a fan of the games, one cannot help but miss the memorable nemeses that were in the game, particularly bosses like the Chariot and the Magician. As a fan of films, I'd occasionally enjoy a cheesy (and sometimes retarded) film, but with Boll's less than stellar hand, this film almost seemed to be a tragedy, for it could have been a fun horror film like EVIL DEAD. I do not deny that Boll is a movie fan, I only question his ability to direct.As a side-note, the writer's commentary on the DVD was interesting, for it explained what he had wanted to write. One could not help but feel sorry that his script was given to such an awful director, and that it had such a low budget, for it sounded quite promising. However, Altman does manage to redeem himself with the more mindlessly enjoyable HOUSE OF THE DEAD 2. Boll, on the other hand, continues to do video game adaptations, which includes FAR CRY, BLOODRAYNE, ALONE IN THE DARK, Dungeon Siege, and POSTAL, where in a bizarre publicity stunt he challenged his critics to a boxing match.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: Back when this movie came out, I worked as a teen at a movie theatre and got to watch free movies all the time, so avid movie watcher here.This is the only movie I have ever left from the movie theatre because it was so bad and couldn't stand to watch. This is the worst movie I have ever seen my whole life. Do not waste your time on this movie.I tend to like a lot of movies and I am really not a hard critic, but this doesn't even fall into the "its so bad we should watch this because its bad" category, it actually made me angry to watch this. If you think "Well with all these bad reviews, I have to at least see how bad it was to know what I was missing" - No. DON'T do this to yourself.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: I have seen some bad movies in my day but, this takes the cake. All those who have not seen this, I invite you to partake in this, just to know what a bad movie is. I won't give away too much but, when zombies who have been dead for decades are engaging in swordplay........I don't need to say more about that do I? I have noticed that someone rated this movie as a 10. It is because of people like that, that this movie doesn't get the true place in the bottom 100 movies on IMDb. It needs to be in the bottom 5 at least. I know that some of you will read this and say, "I know what a bad movie is, I don't need to see this to know", I say to you, look at this and then decide. They have many scenes where they show the video game where the movie came from during the movie. There are zombies that look like trees and then they stand up and start fighting. This movie was in the movie theatre, so it has to be in a different category than "Critters 4". Someone funded this film and they should be ashamed.

reviews.review_title: A plot in the search of a story with decent FX
reviews.content: "a group of teens go to an island for a rave" I can destroy this one quickly.. these people haven't been teens, to be generous, in 5 years. A rave? Geez, I've seen better raves at the mall on kiddie night.. THIS RAVE HAS CORPORATE SPONSORS! Enough of that.. Uwe Boll, if that is his real name (I know I wouldn't put my real name on this slice of dreck) should hide his face in shame. What should have been a decent man eating zombie movie has become, and I say this sincerely, potboiler. The characters are cliché, the villains are cliché, and the supporting cast is cliché. The FX were pretty decent, but EVEN THE FREAKING STUNTS WERE Cliché!!! They looked like something out of "The A Team". Uwe Boll tries to be the Ang Lee of the American cinema. He uses a HELL OF A LOT of those freeze frame tricks, and they detract from the movie, in my opinion. Too much eye candy causes brain decay, Uwe! Too much time expansion, I mean, come on, 5 to 7 minutes to cross 50 yards, even with zombies is a BIT MUCH! I didn't time it the first time, and I can't bring myself to watch it again to get the correct time. The first time felt like am eternity. I haven't seen anything this bad in years, and I can't remember last time I did, even stretching my considerable mental facilities to their fullest! I could have done better with a Betacam and a minimum editing facility, as long as I had a decent FX house behind me. The zombies were fairly decent, if, you guessed it, cliché. If you want a real zombie movie with a halfway decent plot and story, don't waste your time on this pile of recycled dreck, watch one of the Romero movies, or Sam Raimi's "Evil Dead" movies, or even one of the "Return Of The Living Dead" movies (except 4 or 5) *** LEAVE THIS ON THE SHELVES AT THE VIDEO STORE *** Even the sex scenes were cliché, and about as sexy as watching octogenarians go at it.My humble opinionBill

This really is the worst movie (if that's an insult to movies then I'm sorry) I have ever seen and I thought I had seen some rubbish.I'm really am trying to think of something good about it. Erm.... its fairly short?At least I have learnt a lesson from this experience. Have a little more faith in reviews!

Atrociously Bad Horror/Acton Movie. The acting is clueless (Sadly it looks like they are trying), horrific dialogue, no chemistry, no charm, generic and no likeable characters. At its best the acting is ok (10% of the time) and the rest just beyond bad. The cinematography is.....bad is putting it lightly. Everything looks cheaply made, terrible lit and cheap makeup designs. The camera angles are terrible with no focus and the only consistently is every angle is uninspired and terrible. The music is a weird hardcore hip hop with generic orchestra music that is awful and doesn't work at all. The editing is truly atrocious. Scenes go on way too long like the 10 minute fight to the cabin which is the worst part of the film along with cuts to the video game which don't fit at all and should've been cut. This feels like it wants to be a Action/Horror hybrid but fails at scaring and fails at making you wowed by action. This all leads to a truly awful pacing where you don't care at all about anyone, your not scare, or invested or waiting to see what happens next. you just want this to end because you are bored beyond belief. The story is very basic and the one thing to credit this is there is at least a bare bone flow of story albeit filled with terrible storytelling elements the whole way but at least there is a plot and the camera is tuned on. That's it I don't have anything else positive to say. This was beyond a bad one. No one should watch this. I regret I did.

Most movies based off videogames are not good. In fact they're pretty much downright garbage. Which brings us to "House of the Dead" a 2003 Uwe Boll film adaptation of the popular arcade rail shooter. Some might have 2 questions.
1. who's Uwe Boll? 2. What's a rail shooter?


Uwe Boll is a director synonymous with straight to DVD B movie horror/action ; with the "Rampage" trilogy, "In the Name of the King 3", and "Bloodrayne" 2 and 3. I don't know if "House of the Dead" got a theater release ,but if so I'm sure it was short lived. 

As for rail shooters. They're your typical arcade shooting games house of the dead, area 51, metal slug. They're games were you're rout is predetermined, most of them move the character for you,you just aim and shoot. There's little dialogue and the plot is simplistic and usually explained in 2 or 3 brief cutscenes. They're still awesome games, but how do you expand on that to make a 90 minute movie? Well after watching "House of the Dead" I can tell you this movie is clearly not the answer.

Our main characters consist of two douchey college guys, three hot girls( tough black girl,dumb blonde, and smart brunette), a kermudgenly German boat captain smuggling weapons, a coast guard badass chick, and Clint Howard as the first mate. That's a bad sign when you have a main party of seven actors nobody knows and Clint Howard is the most famous person in this film.

Our group is on their way to the rave of the year which is being held on Isle de Muerte. Despite missing the ferry to the island and the German captains warning, they pay him to take them anyway. They show up to the island of death and find the rave completely deserted and wrecked( they even find a shirt covered in blood); but think nothing of it and pour themselves some beers and try to hookup.

Zombies inevitably show up and our troop of morons start running through the woods. The blonde girl gets zombified, and her stupid boyfriend then gets eaten. They run into another group of survivors who were at the rave earlier; including my favorite character ,Liberty(an Asian raver girl in a united States flag jumpsuit who kills zombies with knives and roundhouse kicks).

Kirk the German captain shows up to reveal he was smuggling weapons and all hell breaks loose as we get a bad zombie shoot em up; with shitty editing, and horrible techno music throughout. It's so generic that they keep splicing in footage from the "House of the Dead" videogame;like they have to keep reminding you that the movie is based on the game.

There's a Ludacris shoot out scene with a really bad P.O.D sounding song that goes on way too long. Characters and zombies start dieing left and right. There's still not much revealed about the plot. In fact we're not introduced to the villian until an hour and fifteen minutes into a hot and a half movie.

The villian is an evil scientist who's been doing experiments for centuries and has made an immortality serum( Original :/ ). He's doing some weird stuff to make a perfect being,not really sure; even the short exposition is vague. He bites the dust in a death so ridiculous I won't ruin it if you decide to watch this movie. The movie ends in a cliffhanger thinking there will be a sequel, and guess what? They made "House of the Dead 2".

So as far as bad videogame movies go House of the Dead is upper echelon trash. Is it worth a watch? With enough of your friends to rip on it, it's definitely worth a view. It's by no means good, but it's so stupid and poorly done it's funny.

Another Uwe Boll video game adaptation means yet another inept effort at making a watchable film. This time we take what I'm sure is a heavily plotted, intelligent and character driven game that demanded a film adaptation (not really) and make it into a boring, generic zombie movie. It's "House of the Dead" people, and it sucks. The plot begins with a character informing us that he will be the only survivor. I love it when bad movies spoil their own endings; it's the equivalent a kid with no legs challenging a pro soccer player to a game. At least this movie has the courtesy of letting me know it's garbage right away, instead of jerking me around.

Simon (Tyron Leitso) introduces his soon-to-be-dead friends: Greg (Will Sanderson), Alicia (Ona Grauer), Karma (Enuka Okuma) and Xynthia (Sonya Salomaa, possibly playing some kind of alien that happens to look like a human). They want to go to an awesome rave party taking place on an island but little do they know, the place is overrun by zombies. Hitching a ride there by paying two smugglers (Jurgen Prochnow as Captain Victor Kirk and his first Mate Salish, played by Clint Howard) they are chased by a harbor police officer named Jordan Casper (Ellie Cornell). It's a struggle for survival and a struggle for the audience to resist falling asleep.

The only good thing about this film is the makeup effects, which are actually pretty convincing. There's a huge army of zombies attacking our heroes and they come in all kinds of shapes and sizes. We've got aquatic zombies that can swim, moss-covered zombies that hide in the dirt, ancient skeletal zombies and even fresh zombies that basically look like regular people but with some blood all over them. If there's one good thing that could come out of this film, it's a recommendation to any aspiring horror filmmakers to hire the costume and makeup artists that were involved in this movie. Everything else is downright terrible.

Not only does the movie drop the ball from the very beginning by telling us exactly who is going to make it out alive and who isn't but it commits the biggest sin in cinema "show, don't tell". We don't learn in any way that's organic who the main characters are, we are simply told exactly enough information to distinguish the actors from each other with exposition at the beginning of the movie. Considering the fact that the acting is pretty weak here, maybe it was a last minute decision by director Uwe Boll to avoid as many scenes of the actors talking as possible. Some would give props to the man, but I say next time, just hire real actors

The plot is utterly predictable, not only because we are told ahead of time what is going to happen (no, I will not let that go), but because it doesn't do anything new when it comes to the zombie horror genre. Basically every scene of people talking is just an excuse to tie together an accompanying scene where the humans are running away from or shooting at zombies. To remind us that this is a video game movie, and also presumably to obliterate any tension that might arise, the film constantly flashes to video game-y scenes. We've got clips of the game the film is based on, as well as "game over" type screens for some of the characters that end up biting the dust. I wish I could make up something as stupid as this. Can you imagine if someone re-edited "Saving Private Ryan" and called it "Call of Duty" by adding "game over" screens whenever someone was shot down? Even that movie, which is widely accepted as a masterpiece would be laughed out of theatres, so what chance does "House of the Dead" have with its undead-like acting abilities and paper-thin story? The movie can't even stay consistent because only some of the actors are dignified with a death screen. Meanwhile, we get 32 nearly-identical shots of polygon-based undead creatures getting shot in the face.

It's never particularly scary and even if what the hacks in charge were aiming for was a horror-action movie, leaning more towards action it would still suck the big one. There's a big scene where all of the characters have found an ammo crate (get it? Like in a video game!) and suit up for battle. They make their way to the mysterious "house of the dead" and encounter a huge army of zombies. For a while, it's pretty cool to see. Our remaining heroes take down legions of undead using various weapons and fancy fighting moves but the scene drags on and on. It begins by being kind of cool (maybe because before then you were falling asleep) then becomes ridiculous and funny and finally ends by being totally boring.

Even the ending of the movie ends in a big WTF moment that doesn't really make any sense. Even if you had the lowest standards imaginable, and I have been known to exhibit this illness, and basic zombie action with frequent moments of "girls gone wild" type nudity would interest you, the plot is so badly written, so poorly acted that there is no way you can enjoy yourself. I laughed at a moment where a party goer refused to go skinny dipping with a hot woman just so he could get killed by a zombie but like so many of Uwe Boll's films, you can't even enjoy this film ironically. It was a chore to get through and while I can, once again, praise the special effects, the surrounding story is terrible and you shouldn't waste your time with "House of the Dead". (Director's Cut On Dvd, June 6, 2014)
Jeez, this was really bad. Pretty much everything that was wrong, was very wrong.

A part of me wonders if this was actually a film? There's a solid case to be made that this was in fact not a film, but just Uwe Bol and his crew quickly running through one of those cheap haunted house shows that open up every Halloween, and counting every customer who paid to have some Party City costumed high school dropout jump out and scream at them as a cast member. I can sleep better at night knowing that was the case and that this wasn't an actual attempt at making a movie that somehow managed to get distribution while other much more talented amateur filmmakers, still waiting for their big break, shake their fist angrily at the sky and yell, "WHY, GOD?!!! WHY?!!!!!!!"

Implausible story (even for a story including the living dead), completely unlikable cast, boring action and on top of it all everyone is so dumb that you wonder how they made it this far in life without loosing a limb or some other vital thing. Once one of the characters laments his life being over after getting a scratch on his cheek (oh, no, my beauty! Why didn't they kill me??), that was it for me. From one of the most untalented directors of our time, comes one of the worst horror films I have ever seen. "House of the Dead" takes everything you know about zombie flicks and completely ruins it. Having absolutely terrible actors and a script as bad as they come, this film fails to impress even in it's action scenes. The most commendable thing in this film are the many 360* shots throughout the final scene, but when they start to go on endlessly it get's to be tedious, even though the movie is already tedious enough. It is some of the worst filmmaking I have ever seen in a film. For a 12 million dollar budget, this crew should be ashamed of themselves. It is not scary and it is unintentionally funny the whole way through. "House of the Dead" is utter garbage.

Uwe Boll. The name alone should serve as the only warning the average viewer needs for this or any of the other "films" which litter Boll's excremental catalog. This one is painfully bad as Uwe attempts weak camera tricks, tries to coax unimaginative lines out of his mostly talentless cast and drives yet another nail into the coffin of respectability for poor, hapless Jürgen Prochnow. 

It would be one thing if Boll could provide us with at least a semblance of kitsch. I could respect that - really, I could! As awful as most of Roger Corman's films were, at the very least, he never took himself so seriously that he couldn't bring himself to give us a wink when having the clothes torn off of appallingly objectified women or subjecting us to gruesome, poorly effected close-ups. But Boll? His arrogance prevents him from accepting his mediocrity and we are forced to suffer for his cinematic sins. 

The film industry has provided us with some truly and legendarily hideous directors. It is a rare "talent" indeed who can make Tom Six look like Dario Argento by comparison. Bravo, Mr. Boll?

Boll seems to be not so much honing his movie-craft as discovering it as he films movies. The inept and shoddiness of his work pervades every aspect to the point there is no fun in viewing the material as a guilty or ironic pleasure.

Since its release, I've always written House of the Dead off as a terrible piece of celluloid that should never have been made. I have since gone back on that statement for a couple of reasons. Don't get me wrong though. I don't consider it to be any sort of a masterpiece, or even craptastic. It still falls into the category of being an awful movie, but there are a couple of things about it that brought me around to it a little bit more. First of all, there are, in my opinion, very overt humorous moments built into the movie. You don't catch them the first time through because you're too busy focusing on how terrible the whole thing is. Second, it has Clint Howard and William Sanderson in it, so that's got to count for something. Third, it has Ona Grauer's amazing cleavage bouncing around at every turn. Fourth, it's a very good adaptation of the game. Some might call me crazy for saying that, but if you've ever played the game, you know how terrible the story, the story logic and the dialogue is in those games. This movie matches that successfully. It's not that Uwe Boll knew what he was doing or anything (Alone in the Dark proves that), but his lack of talent makes it all work somehow. I can't say that I'd want to stick this on very often, but I did find it slightly more enjoyable this go round and I guess that's the most positive thing I can say about a movie everybody is so negative about - including myself.

Uwe Boll's zombie movie is one of the worst films in the history of cinema. Uwe Boll has gotten himself the reputation of being one of the worst Hollywood directors in history. Based on a popular video game, House of the Dead is a poorly made film that is beyond awful. House of the Dead will disappoint harden zombie fans because this is poorly conceived trash. This film has one thing going for it, it's unintentionally humorous. This film is so bad, that it's hilarious. Uwe Boll actually placed video games scenes in his movie to give it a "video game" type feel. Instead, it's hilarious. The use of cinematography is criminal in this film. Now, I'm an epileptic, and whenever the camera started spinning, I had to cover my eyes because it felt like I was going to have a seizure. If you're looking for a good, entertaining zombie film, you won't find it here because Uwe Boll can't write an effective plot to his films (under the very rare occasion, he's managed to direct two or three watchable films). However, House of the Dead is not watchable, this is a film with no plot, and bad acting, bad special effects, and it feel like a sci fi channel made for TV movie. House of the Dead is yet another prime example as to why video game to screen adaptations do not work. Occasionally they do, but not in the case of Uwe Boll's House of the Dead. If you're looking for a good zombie action film, watch Resident Evil instead, and skip this film. You'll be glad you did.

A few friends take a fishing boat captained by a smuggler to a remote island where a rave is going on. When they arrive, they find the island deserted, save for a few hundred zombies led by an unknown force. I never played the video game this was based on and even if I had, it still wouldn't have affected my rating of this film. It has a poor storyline, questionable characters possessing fighting abilities out of thin air and a final baddie with a stupid agenda for all the mayhem. I wouldn't even call this a zombie film because the undead seem to die from any kind of strike being given. The camera shots, when the characters are in battle, have seizure-like qualities and the random screen shots of the game are just idiotic. There really isn't much to say about this film, except Ona Grauer's breasts seem to be a jewel when shown in slow-motion sequence.

Had I taken to heart the adage "if you have nothing nice to say, say nothing at all" I would not be writing this. I am not a film critic. I know nothing of the craft of making making movies. I, however, realize that there is something fundamentally amiss in us as humans when things such as 'House of the Dead' are allowed to exist.

According to IMDB this 'film' was produced to the tune of $7,000,000 USD.

You watch TV, right? Who doesn't? Don't you hate when you turn on the old boob tube and see some poor starving kid clogging up screen space? I hate seeing that shit! Makes me feel guilty as hell. "For only $.35 a day you too could support little Whatshisface or Whosehername or a child like him or her." Ok, Starving Kids Foundation let's do some math. $7,000,000 is 20 million kids for one day. Or let's just say a kid is only a kid until they can help out the family by working at the local Nike factory. We'll say 12 years old. That means that if this film never existed and some nice investor gave the money instead to the Starving Kids Foundation, said foundation could feed 4,563 kids until the age of 12. Instead we have 'House of the Dead'.

What is there to say that has not already been said? The only reason to write another review of this movie is to demonstrate your creative ability in thinking up further insults for it. Flaming pile of dog shit. Already been used? Damn. Like watching a late term abortion performed with a piece of jagged glass by a drunk man. Mildly creative. So terrible it will literally give you AIDS. Kinda funny.

More succinctly: if I were a billionaire my first priority would be to buy a giant robot suit (starving kids be damned). Think Gundam. My second priority would be to send out a message to every person who is in possession of this movie on DVD or film. I would offer a bounty. This would include all people who bought it on DVD ironically as well. I would buy all instances of this film and have them destroyed. Further, I would purchase Boll KG and have it disbanded and all workprints of this movie destroyed so as to make it impossible for anybody to ever reproduce it. Further, I would purchase Uwe Boll's assurance to never make another movie again under penalty of nutsack punching. Everyone has a price.

House of the Dead is perhaps one of the worst video game movies of all time. Why? It's directed by Uwe Boll. That says a lot. For those of you who do not know who Uwe Boll is, he is a German director who has a reputation for making some of the worst movies of all time, but considers them to be good and has no intentions of retiring. He's widely considered to be the new Ed Wood. For those of you who don't know who Ed Wood is, well, google him along with Uwe Boll if you like. Anyway, this movie is almost nothing like the game it was based off of. It feels like somebody made an original zombie film and slapped the House of the Dead title on it. It's not even set in a house. The whole thing takes place on an island. None of the characters from the game appear either. They're all movie-exclusive characters. Most of the actors are pretty much all unknowns, with the exception of Eliie Cornell, Jonathan Cherry, Jürgen Prochnow, and Clint Howard. They had done some mentionable work before this. The acting wasn't exactly spectacular either. One thing I don't understand is why Uwe Boll decided to splice in footage of the actual gameplay during the action scenes. Maybe that was the only way to connect the movie to the game? Since nothing else really seemed to follow. Whatever the case, I found it to be annoying and completely distracting. Honestly, this movie probably would have been pretty good if it wasn't called House of the Dead and didn't have the video game scenes. The only things in common the movie had with the games were the enemies, a first person shooter scene toward the end, and the main Character Rudy's last name being Curien. Other than that, it's really got nothing to do with the classic arcade game. As a zombie movie, it's not too bad. As a House of the Dead movie, it's awful. If you have never played a House of the Dead game and know absolutely nothing about it, than you may like this movie. But fans of the games, you might want to stay away.

I know that this is one of the most universally loathed horror films . . . well, ever.  But I just can't bring myself to hate it.  This film is like my (non-existent) teenage brother.  He keeps screaming over and over again "Look what I can do!" and "Dude, do you know what would be cool?!"

I can't stand the idea of hurting his feelings by mocking his choice.  So I remove my Glasses of Cynicism (otherwise known as my cynicles) and I take a look at House of the Dead the way that he wants me to see it.

Yeah, it has its moments.  It really, truly does.

It has topless girls - several.  It has zombies.  It has a creepy house.  It has the longest and most drawn-out action sequence I've ever seen (if you don't count The Matrix franchise).  There are 360s.  There are underwater zombies.  There is a sword fight.   I AM GETTING ENTHUSIASTIC JUST WRITING ABOUT IT!  YEAH!

House of the Dead?  Yeah, see it.  But take off your cynicles first.

I reviewed House of the Dead in depth on Stream of Screams here: http://specterphage.wordpress.com/2011/04/26/hulu-horrors-house-of-the-dead/

House of the Dead is a terribly made film based on the arcade game of the same name. Made by the infamous Uwe Boll, it bears no resemblance to the game at all, has awful acting, terrible effects, dizzying camera work some hilarious interspersed scenes of the actual game itself. That said it manages to never be boring because there is always something on screen for you to cringe at.

The so called plot revolves around a group of college students who go to an island for a rave party. They hire a fishing boat to bring them there despite the fishermen?s warnings that the island is cursed. Once they get there they quickly realise that something is wrong when none of the party goers are anywhere to be seen. Soon enough they are being slaughtered by a group of terrible looking zombies. There is nothing wrong with the plot it's just incredibly poorly made. How Uwe Boll ever got a job directing a film I will never know. The camera work is all over the place, it looks like a terribly made music video. 360 degree shots of characters are supposed to look cool but instead make you feel nauseous. At one point there is a 4 minute montage of 2 second scenes as a hard rock song plays. That part is literally a music video! How he ever thought including actual scenes from the game into the film was a good idea I?ll never know.

Still, it moves along at a fast pace and has plenty of terrible action. Some scenes are vaguely entertaining but the ineptness of Boll drags the whole thing.

A truly awful director and a very poor film.
This has got to be one of the worst movies ever made

Dr. Uwe strikes again.  I knew this was based on a video game, but I couldn't recall the actual game.  I thought it might have been that first-person shooter in the arcade where you just shoot zombies in a haunted house, but that couldn't be it, right?  That's barely a premise for a video game, never mind a movie, RIGHT?  Well, that's what it is, and in case you forgot what it is, they continually splice (and I am not making this up) actual action from the video game into the movie... Yeah.  What the hell were they thinking?  So the rave of the year (thrown by Sega, of all companies) is being thrown on this island that attracts this annoying band of twenty-somethings.  The island is soon overrun by zombies, but not any zombies.  We are talking jumping, acrobatic zombies that could easily compete in a triathlon.  The survivors try to escape the island.  It's a movie that does everything wrong.  As a zombie movie, it just makes up rules as it pleases, with zombie bites sometimes changing the victims into the undead, and sometimes just leaving the victim with a bite mark.  There are a number of noticeable continuity errors, and it blatantly rips off a number of different movies, like The Matrix and The Lord of the Rings.  The acting is amazingly bad and the dialogue is filled with "are you fucking kidding me?"  You can find more likable characters in a Friday the 13th movie, and pretty much the only thing this movie has going for it is that it has some pretty cool music that sounds like a Prodigy knockoff band.  There's this hilarious part in the movie where they take literal breaks in the action to give every single character a freeze frame 360 shot.  It's impressively bad, but there's a reason why Uwe Boll is so infamous.
ugh. this is pretty much one of the worst movies ever made...

-this is the second worst movie i've ever seen (under Boll's Postal).  Listen to how bad this plot is: teenagers go to an island to go to a rave- miss the boat so pay a sea captin 1,000$ to drive them to the island and when they get there everyone is dead because of the zombie attack.  they stay on the island since there is beer and to look around to see what happened....and then get attacked by zombies.  and yes, that is actually the plot...i wish i was exaggerating how bad it was.  It would almost be funny if it wasn't so painful.  The worst acting i have EVER seen and the worst script i've ever heard.  Also, only 15 minutes (tops) of the movie take place in the actual house...most takes place on an island and some in the catacombs (a mine) since Boll gets cheap access to islands and mines.  In addition they keep flashing clips of the video game in the middle of the scenes.  I am not sure if this was supposed to remind you what movie you were watching or what...but it was just stupid.  among the worst costumes and make up i have ever seen, some of the zombies are hilarious (not intentionally).  I can not say enough bad stuff about this movie...there is absolutely nothing redeeming in this movie at all.  just don't watch it unless you want to put your self through a horrible painful movie viewing experience or want to see exactly how bad a movie can be.

Famously rubbish film director Uwe Boll directs (there's an overstatement) this nonsensical, dire zombie movie based on the popular arcade game and creates a film so bad you'll be trying for weeks to forget the game and its film adaptation even existed in the first place.

Basically a bunch of students pay a THOUSAND dollars to go to a rave on a creepy island (who does that???) only to find that it's full of crappy-looking zombies who, although they can swim, have never even tried to leave the island and take over the world. They are just not that ambitious.

A bunch of intensely annoying twenty somethings get butchered one by one as poor old Jurgen Prochnow (Das Boot) tries to look for his career somewhere inside his boat for about an hour. Uwe Boll throws actual shots from the game at us every chance he gets (BAAAAAD IDEA), rips off The Matrix's bullet-time effects about 200 million times, throws away all notions of continuity and references Scooby Doo.

Terrible terrible film. But if you like bad movies, as I do, you can't go wrong with this one.

Ok.  It's ludicrously awful, but come on, Ed Wood anyone?  Someone has to be out there, making the world's worst movies, if only to serve as whipping boy for the rest of the film industry.
The film is atrocious.  It's truly awful.  But it's also fun, if you're drunk that is.
I don't know.  I mean, movies like this have to exist and while this movie is fucking awful, I don't see it as any worse than the other end of the spectrum, the bloated, big budget, hollywood whatever-the-fucks, I mean, I'd rather George Clooney stop directing movies than Uwe Boll.
That being said, I couldn't finish this relatively short movie because I wasn't drunk enough and it was like watching the cool kids from high school (YOUR high school) trying to act really, really genuinely, so genuinely that it's the phoniest shit you've ever seen, but no one will tell them because they are so attractive, watching them fight off rejects from Michael Jackson's "Thriller".
I mean, it's like Boll obviously put some effort into it, just why put in the effort in all the wrong places unless you're some kind of artistic genius whose trying to destroy the video game community's artistic credibility one film at a time.
I look forward to trying to watch more Boll films, if only to try to make some sense of the insanity. His work is a straight up cultural anomaly, because unlike the evil, worthless duo behind Epic Movie and Date Movie, there actually might be something to Boll, just what, I have no idea.

Recently, I decided to bite the bullet and watch a Uwe Boll movie. If it was actually worth it is definitely questionable, but, I did manage to get some good laughs and a new Top Worst Film of All Time.

So, let's get this out of the way. Uwe Boll's House of the Dead lives up to the hype. It really is the worst (zombie) movie ever made. I cannot stress that enough really...it IS pure crap. Honestly, the only thing this movie is good for is unintentional laughs or a good nap. I found myself dozing off in a few of the action scenes as they were just plain boring. (And for some reason I decided to rewind some of them to see if I missed out on story?whoops! Bad mistake there)! The acting is atrocious, the score is beyond annoying (seriously, techno beats throughout the whole movie??), the story is almost non-existent, the characters are unbelievable and unlikeable (we get nil development and all stupidity) and the special effects are appalling.

For those who have no idea what House of the Dead is about, it is only fair to fill you in. Based off the popular rail-shooting arcade games, this follows a group of teens who are trying to get to a rave on an island. They miss their scheduled boat by 15 minutes, so they pay a smuggler to take them there. Upon arrival, they discover everyone is gone and the place is trashed. Do they leave? Nope, they stay for the free beer and to wander around in groups. They soon discover the island is infested with zombies, so they take refuge in a house and try survive the night.

I do not know what could have been going through Boll's brain (if it exists) when he was making this. Shouldn't a smart, normal human realise they are making a bad movie when your teenage ravers can shoot shotguns, desert eagles and sub-machine guns with 100% precision and accuracy? Oh, and they can also perform high level martial arts! Shouldn't an intelligent man know its a bad movie when your action scenes directly rip-off "The Matrix" with poor CGI and dodgy slo-mo? Finally, how the holy $#*& can someone think inserting game footage into the movie makes it better? I am not joking when I say this, Boll actually includes numerous clips from the game during the action scenes and even includes a Game Over screenshot when one of the ravers dies! House of the Dead is consistently good at being absolute trite. With zombies that look identical (and are able to swim, sword-fight and get angered by breaking tanks full of red water), with bullets igniting barrels of gunpowder and with the power to get stabbed and die, but get up and crush a zombie's head only to die again, Uwe Boll has successfully created the most idiotic film in history. The movie is funny, though, and many could find joy at laughing at the many plot holes and clichés abundant throughout. Moreover, the random nudity may please some? Congratulations, Mr. Boll, you have managed to rape what could have been at least a mediocre movie!

With that said, there are only 3 things about this movie that actually keep me from want to hunt down and kill Uwe Boll:
Boobs, Cuban Cigar smoking captain, and an very hot chick. She, however, doesn't show her boobs which is extremely upsetting.
But, for the love of God, don't ever watch this.

The sense of horror a horror-survival movie should inflict on the viewer should be that of horror-survival. The survival element was there, but dilluted, and there was a very vague sense of horror in that the zombies acted like a bunch of mindless morons. An interesting thing that was incorporated into the movie were scenes from the actual House of the Dead video game. This novelty, though a good idea, failed to be the movie's saving grace. In the end we have a complete waste of time and money, and unless you are a die-hard (no pun intended) fan of House of the Dead, and I mean die-hard fan, you should stay as far away as you can from this movie.

The second you see the letters U W E B O L L arranged in the dreaded order that spells the name of the horrible German director (Lou Woll) in the opening credits, you know you are in a for a bad film. Wow...my opening joke here sucks.The second you see the letters U W E B O L L arranged in the dreaded order that spells the name of the horrible German director (Lou Woll) in the opening credits, you know you are in a for a bad film. Wow...my opening joke here sucks.Acting/characters: Shallow, generic, and underdeveloped that's all I can say about them. I kept hoping that there would be someone in the whole film who I would think "maybe this one will be different and kinda likable" out of the whole cast, no one fit that bill. I can't even remember their names without looking them up with the exception of Kirk. Even as I write this, their names and faces slip from my mind. That is for the best I feel. I just do not care about them whatsoever. Who could? Maybe the 3 or 4 people out there who like this film say 'the characters are so incidental because this is a cheesy action flick and nothing more.' To those 3 or 4 people (including Uwe Boll) I say, if I want this many faceless characters, I'll go play the video game itself. It's a movie so it should have at least one character worth anything. This doesn't. Plus, the character who narrates the film is so dumb. Well, not just him, the whole concept of the character. A narrator is our protagonist. We are seeing the film from his or her eyes. This guy wasn't in the film for the first third of it. Once he was you never got to really know him at all. It's like he was just there and was narrating it in passing later. I dunno maybe the script did have a likable character, well if so, the actors killed it. They all absolutely sucked. I think one of them went on to do something worthwhile after this...how? They were monotonous, blank, and uninteresting. 0/10Plot: I've read the plot to the original game. This one is supposed to be a prequel to that game in a sense...no matter what angle you look at it from the two are not connected plot-wise at all. This would be fine I suppose but Uwe Boll decided to use a plot that has been circulating on the Slasher Genre for decades: Teenagers at a party in an abandoned location are being killed off. So, not only did he not even try to tie it into the actual source material itself, he decided to use an old, over-used plot to do it. Way to go Uwe! You've sunk to a new low. At least I haven't seen the plot to Alone in the dark 50 times in 50 different movies like this one. You didn't even try. You didn't even try. 0/10Screenplay: If I asked Uwe Boll what he thought about the script for this film he would give me a blank stare and say 'the what for my film?' an exaggeration to be sure, but not that much of one. Some lines in there just had my head ringing. Which ones?...all of them...yeah, all of them. I don't know who wrote this screenplay or why but they should be banned from ever making a screenplay again. This comes off like some kid wrote it. No offense to kids. Come on people this is a movie1 You get paid to do this! Now I'm not saying it has to be Casablanca but can you please not try to outdo Troll 2 in terms of stupidity? 0/10Likableness: I add Uwe Boll to my list of directors who love slow-mo too much (move over Michael Bay and Zack Snyder). And he's just friggin' lazy too. There is one shot that he reuses 4 DIFFERENT TIMES!!! I mean come on! Twice is pushing it but 4!?!?! I highly disliked this film and I will probably never watch it again. I would advise everyone who has not seen this to go and watch something better. Like the Garfield movie (oh snap) and leave this alone. It was terrible. I never thought it was possible to achieve so many mistakes and bad choices in a row. This movie is a monument, no doubt of it. Where did it go wrong? Oh yes, adapting a rail-shooter game as a movie. Why did no one instantly react to thisI never thought it was possible to achieve so many mistakes and bad choices in a row. This movie is a monument, no doubt of it. Where did it go wrong? Oh yes, adapting a rail-shooter game as a movie. Why did no one instantly react to this idea? Anyway the worst is done. Now let's review it.Overall acting is terrible. Dialogues are one of the dumbest of the whole history of cinema. Women (excepted the cop one) are all here to showcase their breasts (and their bodies in some extent). Scenario is dreadful, unoriginal and predictable. Jokes are unfunny, dull and vulgar. Some scenes are plagiarized from 'Jaws'. Special effects, costumes and make-up are horrible. Overall lighting is a mess. Characters are over-stereotyped. It is impossible to develop any empathy for any of them. Scenes are awfully shot, with way too many cuts and inappropriate flashes of the original game. Sega company takes its enormous bundles of bills in the beginning of the movie when they accepted to show their brand during that truly indecent party. Music and original score are agressive and also inappropriate. I found pace was quite good excepted during fights which all were way too long.Don't get me wrong, despite the 2/10 it is clearly a movie that I will rewatch with pleasure because I certainly missed a lot of its flaw on the first view. I am quite fascinated by this.

rt_summary: Simon (Tyron Leitso) and Greg (Will Sanderson) meet a group of friends and set out to attend a rave on a remote island. When they miss the ferry, they decide to ride with Kirk (Jürgen Prochnow), a smuggler. They find the island deserted and discover that the partygoers have been killed by zombies. Now, the group must evade the deadly creatures and try to find safety. However, the only means of escape -- Kirk's boat -- has been overrun, forcing the survivors to ward off the undead.
meta_summary: Based on the best selling video game from Sega, House of the Dead tells the story of a group of college students who go to a rave on a mysterious island and get more than they bargained for when they find themselves stalked by killer zombies and terrifying creatures intent on feasting on the flesh of the living.  (Artisan Entertainment)
